inoptabilis: <entryFree id="n23650" type="main" key="i^nopta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-optābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undesirable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officinae disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inoptatus: <entryFree id="n23651" type="main" key="i^nopta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-optātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undesired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Contr. 8:6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Contr. 8, 6, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inopus: <entryFree id="n23652" type="main" key="I_no_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnōpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">*)inwpo/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n23652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain and river in the island of Delos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Latona brought forth Apollo and Diana. It is said to have risen and fallen at the same time with the Nile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and hence was supposed to be connected with it by a subterraneous channel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 166, § 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:105" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inorabilis: <entryFree id="n23653" type="spur" key="i^no_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnōrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e, false reading for evocabili</itype>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 487, 15</bibl>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Fragm. v. 158" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Fragm. v. 158</bibl> Rib.</entryFree>
inoratus: <entryFree id="n23654" type="main" key="i^no_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not pleaded</hi>: incertā re atque inoratā, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without obtaining a hearing</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 166, 23</bibl> (Trag. v. 12 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">legati Ameriam re inorata reverterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inordinaliter: <entryFree id="n23655" type="main" key="i^nordi^na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnordĭnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-ordinalis</etym>, <sense id="n23655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irregularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scarificandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inordinate: <entryFree id="n23656" type="main" key="i^nordi^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnordĭnātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnordĭnātim</orth>, <sense id="n23656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. inordinatus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inordinatio: <entryFree id="n23657" type="main" key="i^nordi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ordĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disorder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 92, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 43, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inordinatus: <entryFree id="n23658" type="main" key="i^nordi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ordĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not arranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inordinati et incompositi milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 50, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inordinati in proelium ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 292</bibl></cit> Oud. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inordinatissimi pili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 45, § 91</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idque ex inordinato in ordinem adduxit,</quote> <trans><tr>disorder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:23" default="NO">8, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO">10, 4, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n23658.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnordĭnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irregularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres redire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so 1, 4. — </sense><sense id="n23658.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnordĭnātim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">irregularly</hi>: <cb n="INQU" /> acies non inordinatim incedebant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inordino: <entryFree id="n23659" type="main" key="i^nordi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ordĭno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring into order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inordinandi soli duo sunt tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 9</bibl></cit> dub. (al. ordinandi).</sense></entryFree>
inorior: <entryFree id="n23660" type="spur" key="i^no^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>false reading for oreretur</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl>.</entryFree>
inoris: <entryFree id="n23661" type="gloss" key="i^no_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ōs</etym>, <sense id="n23661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a mouth</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inormis: <entryFree id="n23662" type="main" key="i^normis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnormis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-norma</etym>, <sense id="n23662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immoderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Anton. Get. 6, 2</bibl>; Ael. Ver. 1, 3 acc. to Salmas (al. enormis).</sense></entryFree>
inornate: <entryFree id="n23663" type="main" key="i^norna_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnornātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inornatus.</entryFree>
inornatus: <entryFree id="n23664" type="main" key="i^norna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ornātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi> (syn. incomptus): <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 497</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 472</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lysias tenuis atque inornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:50" default="NO">8, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:59 al" default="NO">59 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina et verba,</quote> <trans><tr>plain</tr>, <tr>common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego te meis Chartis inornatum silebo,</quote> <trans><tr>uncelebrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 31</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnornātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 31, 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: inornatius scribere, Fronto ad Verum Imp. ep. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
inorno: <entryFree id="n23665" type="main" key="i^norno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-orno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adorn</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">flosculi inornantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inoro: <entryFree id="n23666" type="hapax" key="i^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crown the brim</hi> of a drinking-vessel: <cit><quote lang="la">calix de coronis quoque potatoris inorabitur (al. inornabitur),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inorus: <entryFree id="n23667" type="main" key="i^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-os</etym>, <sense id="n23667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without a mouth</hi>: ostreae, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 216, 8</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 23 Rib.; cf. Müll. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
inotiosus: <entryFree id="n23668" type="main" key="i^no_ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ōtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not idle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">a)/sxolos</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:183" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inous: <entryFree id="n23669" type="main" key="I_no_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Īnōüs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Ino <sense id="n23669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inp: <entryFree id="n23670" type="main" key="inp"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inp-</orth>, v. imp-.</entryFree>
inpraesentiarum: <entryFree id="n23671" type="main" key="inpraesenti^a_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inpraesentĭārum</orth>, v. impr-.</entryFree>
inprimis: <entryFree id="n23672" type="main" key="inpri_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-prīmis</orth>, v. primus, II. B.</entryFree>
inquaesitus: <entryFree id="n23673" type="main" key="inquaesi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-quaesītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, i. q. inquisitus, <sense id="n23673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sought for</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inquam: <entryFree id="n23674" type="main" key="inquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquam</orth> (the foll. forms are found: inquam and inquit very freq.; <sense id="n23674.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; <hi rend="ital">first pers.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inquio</orth>, found in late writers: si igitur, inquio, Jul. ap. Aug. c. Saec. Resp. Jul. 4, 9, is not in good use, but mentioned by Vel. Long. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Orthogr. p. 2287</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, 11, 62</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inquo, Eutych. 2, 12, p. 2182: inquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:93:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 93, 1</bibl> saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">inquĭmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:169" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 50, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquiebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 12, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 24, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 55</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in eccl. Lat. inquiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 22, 18</bibl></cit>; Marc. 12, 26; Greg. Ep. 8, 12; 12, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 2</bibl>, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 612 sqq.), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. defect.</hi> [kindred to Sanscr. khyā, dicere, praedicare, celebrare, appellare; cf. Bopp Gloss. p. 98, 6 sq.], <hi rend="ital">I say</hi>, placed after one or more words of a quotation, our <hi rend="ital">say</hi> (<hi rend="ital">said</hi>) <hi rend="ital">I</hi>, <hi rend="ital">says</hi> (<hi rend="ital">said</hi>) <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n23674.1" n="I" level="1"> In citing the words of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">cum respondissem me ex provincia decedere, etiam mehercules, inquit, ut opinor, ex Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est vero, inquam, signum quidem notum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ipsos induxi loquentes, ne inquam et inquit saepius interponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ubi me viderunt, ubi sunt, inquiunt, scyphi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus, Juppiter, inquit, tuis jussus avibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23674.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Quinctius en, inquit mihi, haec ego patior quotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23674.3" n="B" level="2"> Inquam is frequently placed after a word which the speaker strongly emphasizes, esp. in repetitions: <cit><quote lang="la">libera per terras unde haec animantibus exstat, unde est haec, inquam, fatis avulsa potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex maximo conventu Syracusis, in foro, ne quis, etc., in foro, inquam, Syracusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 29, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc unum diem, hunc unum inquam, hodiernum diem defende si potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per mihi, per, inquam, mihi gratum feceris, si,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: delector enim: quamquam te non possum, ut ais, corrumpere, delector,<cb n="INQU" />  inquam, et familia vestra et nomine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas, tuas, inquam, suspiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec inquam, de Oppianico constabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 44, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23674.4" n="II" level="1"> With an <hi rend="ital">indef. subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23674.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: inquiunt, <hi rend="ital">they say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is said</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noluit, inqui unt, hodie agere Roscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:50:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 50, 168 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra dicuntur haec ... natura adfert dolorem, cui quidem Crantor, inquiunt, vester cedendum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 102:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 102, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:85" default="NO">9, 2, 85</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23674.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, esp. in stating objections to one's own arguments, <hi rend="ital">it is said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one says</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply is made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera funebria, quibus luctus augetur, duodecim sustulerunt. Homini, inquit (sc. lex), mortuo ne ossa legito, quo post funus faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 34, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquit (sc. scriptor litterarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 2</bibl>: nec magis quisquam eodem tempore et iratus potest esse, et vir bonus, quam aeger et sanus. Non potest, inquit, omnis ex animo ira tolli, nec hominis natura patitur, Sen. de Ira, 2, 12.— </sense><sense id="n23674.7" n="III" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23674.8" n="1" level="3"> Inquit is sometimes omitted by ellipsis: <cit><quote lang="la">Turpemque aperto pignore errorem probans, En, hic declarat quales sitis judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:692" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 692</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23674.9" n="2" level="3"> It is sometimes inserted pleonastically: <cit><quote lang="la">excepit Demochares: Te, inquit, suspendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc adjunxit: Pater, inquit, meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 2, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23674.10" n="3" level="3"> It is freq. repeated: Crassus. numquidnam, inquit, novi? Nihil sane, inquit Catulus; <cit><quote lang="la">etenim vides esse ludos: sed vel tu nos ineptos, licet [inquit], vel molestos putes, cum ad me in Tusculanum, inquit, heri vesperi venisset Caesar de Tusculano suo, dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 17</bibl>: dicam equidem, Caesar inquit, quid intellegam; <cit><quote lang="la">sed tu et vos omnes hoc, inquit, mementote,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 74, 298</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inquassatus: <entryFree id="n23675" type="gloss" key="inquassa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-quassātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unbroken</hi>: inquassatus, <foreign lang="greek">a)/qraustos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inquies: <entryFree id="n23676" type="main" key="inqui^es1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-quĭes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquietness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigiliarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantis (in utero),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23677" type="main" key="inqui^es2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-quĭes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<case>abl.</case> inquieti, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 42</bibl>), <sense id="n23677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquiet</hi>: homo, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 704</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus, Plin. prooem. § 16 (al. in quiete): inquies atque indomitum ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanus spe, cupidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:77:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 77, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad libidinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inquiescens: <entryFree id="n23678" type="spur" key="inqui^escens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭescens</orth>, <itype>false reading for increscente</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218</bibl>.</entryFree>
inquietatio: <entryFree id="n23679" type="main" key="inqui^e_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭētātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inquieto</etym>, <sense id="n23679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disturbance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 1</bibl> (but false reading for irrita quassatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 17, 3</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
inquietator: <entryFree id="n23680" type="main" key="inqui^e_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭētātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disturber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 23</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 6, 10, 1.</sense></entryFree>
inquiete: <entryFree id="n23681" type="main" key="inqui^e_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inquietus <sense id="n23681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inquieto: <entryFree id="n23682" type="main" key="inqui^e_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-quĭēto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (syn. sollicitare): <cit><quote lang="la">nares digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis rumoribus inquietari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam multis libellis et tam querulis inquietor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: num alio genere furiarum declamatores inquietantur, Petr. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium quiescens,</quote> <trans><tr>by an accusation of adultery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquietatus fremitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inquietudo: <entryFree id="n23683" type="main" key="inqui^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inquieto</etym>, <sense id="n23683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquietude.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23683.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: de aliqua re sustinere, Cod. 7, 14, 5.— </sense><sense id="n23683.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">feverishness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis inquietudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inquietus: <entryFree id="n23684" type="main" key="inqui^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-quĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">restless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquiet</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Liv.): animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux deinde noctem inquieta insecuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:95" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquieta urbs auctionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita oratorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">littora saeviente fluctu inquieta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 78, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: inertia. <pb n="961" /> <cb n="INQU" /> <hi rend="ital">busy idleness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 12:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 8</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquietiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter affectus inquietissimos rem quietissimam fidem quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:26:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 26, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">restlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unquietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without intermission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugis flagrantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquietius agens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inquilina: <entryFree id="n23685" type="main" key="inqui^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 1. inquilinus.</entryFree>
inquilinatus: <entryFree id="n23686" type="main" key="inqui^li_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭlīnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inquilinus</etym>, <sense id="n23686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inhabiting of a place which is not one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sojourning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquilinatūs tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inquilino: <entryFree id="n23687" type="gloss" key="inqui^li_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭlīno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be an inhabitant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sojourner</hi>: inquilino, <foreign lang="greek">e)noike/w,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inquilinus: <entryFree id="n23688" type="main" key="inqui^li_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>incolinus, colo</etym>, <sense id="n23688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of a place which is not his own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sojourner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lodger</hi> (cf. incola). </sense><sense id="n23688.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23688.2" n="A" level="2"> Padi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 43, § 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilienses, qui nunc inquilini videantur, quandoque dominos regionum futuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabrum inquilinum et ferrarium vicinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te inquilino (non enim domino) personabat omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquilini privatarum aedium atque insularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23688.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An inmate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lodger</hi>: inquilinus, qui eundem colit focum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinus alicui vel inquilinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:86:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 86, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam erant perpetui carcerum inquilini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23688.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in quarum locum subierunt inquilinae, impietas, perfidia, impudicitia, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 403, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego non discipulos philosophorum, sed inquilinos voco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima inquilina carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23689" type="main" key="inqui^li_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of foreign birth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis urbis Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inquinabulum: <entryFree id="n23690" type="gloss" key="inqui^na_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inquino</etym>, <sense id="n23690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>: inquinabulum, <foreign lang="greek">mo/lumma,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inquinamentum: <entryFree id="n23691" type="main" key="inqui^na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filth</hi>, Vitr 8, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inquinate: <entryFree id="n23692" type="main" key="inqui^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inquino <sense id="n23692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inquinatio: <entryFree id="n23693" type="main" key="inqui^na_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inquino</etym>, <sense id="n23693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defiling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inquinatus: <entryFree id="n23694" type="main" key="inqui^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from inquino.</entryFree>
inquino: <entryFree id="n23695" type="main" key="inqui^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cunire, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=50" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 50</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n23695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to befoul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi> (syn.: polluo, contamino, conspurco). </sense><sense id="n23695.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentior at si quid, merdis caput inquiner albis Corvorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruris opes niteant: inquinet arma situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:928" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 928</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(gurgitem) venenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem injecto lolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23695.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contaminate</hi>: saepe unus puer petulans atque impurus inquinat gregem puerorum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam nomine criminoso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros turpissimis possessoribus, id. Phil, 2, 17, 43: omnem splendorem honestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis jura et exempla corrumpere domesticaque immanitate inquinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta puerorum foedis amoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:102" default="NO">4, 2, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se parricidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vitiis atque flagitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias et genus et domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter inquinavit aere tempus aureum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">befouled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polluted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23695.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua turbida et cadaveribus inquinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23695.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis murice vellus inquinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23695.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">defiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23695.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus flagitiis vita inquinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil hoc homine inquinatius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidissima ratio et inquinatissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis in voluptate inquinatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: comitia largitione inquinata, id. Q. Petit. Cons. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra inquinatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo inquinatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23695.7" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23695.8" n="a" level="4"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est vitiosum in verbis, si inquinatum, si abjectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus inquinatus, insuavissima littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23695.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tinctured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly imbued</hi> with any thing (cf. A. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteris satis inquinatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. Trag. 46</bibl></cit> Burm.: <cit><quote lang="la">non inquinati sumus (istis vitiis), sed infecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 59 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">filthily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impurely;</hi> loqui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">74, 258</bibl>. <cb n="INSA" /></sense></entryFree>
inquio: <entryFree id="n23696" type="main" key="inqui^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquĭo</orth>, v. inquam <sense id="n23696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inquiro: <entryFree id="n23697" type="main" key="inqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīro</orth>, <itype>sīvi, sītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-quaero</etym>, <sense id="n23697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to seek after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire into</hi> any thing (cf. anquirere). </sense><sense id="n23697.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera illa honestas, quam natura maxime inquirit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquire in ea quae memoriae sunt prodita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum originem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquibus inquirenda quaedam mandare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia (alicujus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit furere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23697.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23697.3" n="A" level="2"> Jurid., <hi rend="ital">to search for grounds of accusation against</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ego diem inquirendi in Siciliam perexiguam postulavissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in competitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus capitalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquisitum missi de iis, quorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23697.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inquire into</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis habet causam celebritatis, in eum quid agat inquiritur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium inquirens in se, atque ipse sese observans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:283" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius ante diem patrios inquirit in annos,</quote> <trans><tr>to inquire how long his father will live</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstitit oceanus in se simul et in Herculem inquiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">searched into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus magna cum cura inquisitum,</quote> <trans><tr>searched for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istanc rem inquisitam certumst non amittere,</quote> <trans><tr>not to neglect inquiry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 217</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīsītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoroughly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inquisitio: <entryFree id="n23698" type="main" key="inqui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inquiro</etym>, <sense id="n23698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seeking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">searching for.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23698.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tu cave inquisitioni mihi sis, <hi rend="ital">be at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">don</hi>'<hi rend="ital">t let me have to look for you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novorum militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8</bibl></cit>. 30, 44, § 106.—</sense><sense id="n23698.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a searching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquiring into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an examination.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23698.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">veri inquisitio atque investigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova inquisitione addiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 46, 45, § 117</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23698.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a seeking for proofs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grounds in support of an accusation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a legal inquisition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua,</quote> <trans><tr>for which a year is allowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:44" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulare inquisitionem in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare inquisitionem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere inquisitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inquisitor: <entryFree id="n23699" type="main" key="inqui_si_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīsītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searcher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23699.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who searches for a suspected person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inquisitor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tracker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detective</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrutatur vestigia (canis) atque persequitur, comitantem ad feram inquisitorem loro trahens,</quote> <trans><tr>the hunter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab inquisitoribus pecunia redimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquisitores algae,</quote> <trans><tr>they who search the very sea-weed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23699.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23699.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum inquisitorem decet esse sapientem, Cic. Fragm. Ac. ap. Aug. cont. Ac. 2, 11: rerum naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23699.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">one who searches for proofs to support an accusation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Norbanus legatus et inquisitor reum postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:25:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inquisitus: <entryFree id="n23700" type="main" key="inqui_si_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. inquiro <sense id="n23700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23701" type="main" key="inqui_si_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inquīsītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-quaero</etym>, <sense id="n23701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not searched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquired into</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inr: <entryFree id="n23702" type="main" key="inr"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inr-</orth>. For words beginning thus, v. irr-.</entryFree>
inrado: <entryFree id="n23703" type="main" key="inra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inrādo</orth>, v. irrado.</entryFree>
inrectus: <entryFree id="n23704" type="main" key="inrectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-rectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not straight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpinari dictum ab inrecto, seu intorto vulpium cursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insaepio: <entryFree id="n23705" type="main" key="insaepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-saepĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, saeptus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hedge in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insaeptio: <entryFree id="n23706" type="main" key="insaeptio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insaeptio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insaepio</etym>, <sense id="n23706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defined surface</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insaeptus: <entryFree id="n23707" type="main" key="insaeptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insaeptus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> of insaepio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23708" type="main" key="insaeptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-saeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not hedged in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not enclosed</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:95:111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 95, 111</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
insaevio: <entryFree id="n23709" type="main" key="insaevi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-saevĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall into a passion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Jos. Patr. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insalubris: <entryFree id="n23710" type="main" key="insa^lu_bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sălūbris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwholesome.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23710.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unhealthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insalubrious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 27</bibl></cit>: in medicina alia salubria, alia insalubria,<cb n="INSA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insalubrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 7</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum insaluberrimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23710.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unseruiceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meridiem vineas spectare colono insalubre est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 20</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insălūbrĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unwholesomely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unserviceably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitably</hi>, Salv. ap. Avar. 3, p. 90: <cit><quote lang="la">indulgere naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 92.</sense></entryFree>
insalutaris: <entryFree id="n23711" type="main" key="insa^lu_ta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sălūtāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not healthful;</hi> <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes, Hilar. in Psa. 118, 13, 14 (also a false read. for salutare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 25</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
insalutatus: <entryFree id="n23712" type="main" key="insa^lu_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sălūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ungreeted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsaluted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis jam multis insalutatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesis: inque salutatam linquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 288</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insanabilis: <entryFree id="n23713" type="main" key="insa_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sānābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be cured</hi> or <hi rend="ital">healed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incurable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23713.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23713.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">irretrievable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without remedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hopeless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil insanabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanabili leto perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 100, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">6: caput insanabile tribus Anticyris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi cacoethes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insānābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">incurably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:45" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 45</bibl>: aeger, Marcell. et Faust. ap. Libr. Prec. ad Imp. p. 19 Sirmond.</sense></entryFree>
insanctus: <entryFree id="n23714" type="gloss" key="insanctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sanctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unholy</hi>: insanctus, <foreign lang="greek">o mh\ a(/gios,</foreign> Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
insane: <entryFree id="n23715" type="main" key="insa_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insanus <sense id="n23715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insania: <entryFree id="n23716" type="main" key="insa_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insanus</etym>, <sense id="n23716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsoundness of mind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23716.1" n="A" level="2"> As a disease, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insanity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18, 2</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n23716.2" n="B" level="2"> As a personal quality, <hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frenzy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senselessness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen insaniae significat mentis aegrotationem et morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanitatem animorum positam in tranquillitate quadam constantiaque censebant: his rebus mentem vacuam appellarunt insaniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furorem esse rati sunt, mentis ad omnia caecitatem: quod cum majus esse videatur, quam insania, tamen ejusmodi est, ut furor in sapientem cadere possit, non possit insania,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concupiscere aliquid ad insaniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to madness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favere alicui ad insaniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adigere ad insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerata belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tanta insania, cives?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus agas, minus est insania turpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:71 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 71 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23716.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc intem periae insaniaeque agitant senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incideram in hominum pugnandi cupidorum insanias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23716.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23716.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Madness</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">excess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagance</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">villarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut appareret, quam ab sano initio res in hanc insaniam venerit, Liv 7, 2, 13: mensarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 91</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23716.6" n="B" level="2"> Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23716.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Poetic enthusiasm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditis? an me ludit amabilis Insania?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insanibilis: <entryFree id="n23717" type="main" key="insa_ni_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insānībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insanio</etym>, <sense id="n23717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
insanio: <entryFree id="n23718" type="main" key="insa_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insānĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum</itype> (<sense id="n23718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 37</bibl></cit>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>insanus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to be of unsound mind</hi> (syn.: furo, deliro, desipio). </sense><sense id="n23718.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23718.2" n="A" level="2"> As a medic. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to be mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi>, of men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7:69 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 69 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of animals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 76, § 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23718.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without reason</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanire ex amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo insanibat (for insaniebat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque eo est commotus, ut insanire omnibus ac furere videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanire tibi videris, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ego insanio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa ratione modoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 271</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23718.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to act like a madman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus fuit hoc, hospes, sumptu tanto, nostra gratia? Insanivisti hercle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amavi equidem olim in adulescentia: Verum ad hoc exemplum numquam ut nunc insanio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanire libet quoniam tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in battle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:668" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 668</bibl></cit>.— Of speech; <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi genus. quod ... specie libertatis insanit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 73</bibl></cit>.—Of a rage for building, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23718.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: errorem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollemnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="962" /> <cb n="INSA" /> 1, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">amores alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be madly in love with one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 32, 25 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">hilarem insaniam insanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23718.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libertinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23718.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua me stultitia insanire putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 302</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanitur a patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insanitas: <entryFree id="n23719" type="main" key="insa_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insanus</etym>, <sense id="n23719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsoundness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhealthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen insaniae significat mentis aegrotationem et morbum, id est insanitatem et aegrotum animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia sanitas sit animi, insipientia autem quasi insanitas quaedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 122, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insaniter: <entryFree id="n23720" type="main" key="insa_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insānĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insanus <sense id="n23720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insanus: <entryFree id="n23721" type="main" key="insa_nus" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsound in mind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23721.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insane</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">furiosus, fanaticus): quod idem contigit insanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fecisset Juno maritum insanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:620" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 620</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23721.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that acts like a madman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frantic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23721.3" n="A" level="2"> Ex stultis insanos facere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrior et insanior cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanissima concio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo insanissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
