Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter est insanior horum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23721.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis insana cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor duri Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insano verba tonare foro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>where there is a great bustle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 134: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis et insana semita nocte sonat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of women raving about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 60: <cit><quote lang="la">insani enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:59" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insana Caprae sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23721.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That causes madness</hi> (cf. "The insane root, that takes the reason prisoner," Shaks. Macb. 1, 3): <cit><quote lang="la">laurum insanam vocant, quoniam si quid ex ea decerptum inferatur navibus, jurgia fiunt, donec abiciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 89, § 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>that produces madness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <trans><tr>that drives one to madness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 413</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23721.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Outrageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monstrous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substructionum insanae moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substructiones Capitolii insanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 2, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stupet insanis acies fulgoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <trans><tr>that bear excessively</tr>, <tr>three times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf. adv., 3. insanum. — </sense><sense id="n23721.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Enthusiastic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraptured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 443</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in three forms. </sense><sense id="n23721.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">insānē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23721.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Madly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insanely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in silvam non ligna feras insanius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanissime desperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 238" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 238</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23721.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Outrageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esuriens insane bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 86</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n23721.11" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sānĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">madly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>: ludit nimium insaniter, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.— </sense><sense id="n23721.12" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">insānum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">outrageously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanum malum = pessimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus, insanum bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum molior negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: valde, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 127, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insanimontes: <entryFree id="n23722" type="main" key="Insa_ni montes" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Insāni montes</orth>, <sense id="n23722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the insane mountains</hi> ( = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ maino/mena o)/rh</foreign>), i. e. absurdly high, Weissenb. (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the raging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stormy mountains</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a range in the western part of Sardinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 39, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardiniam Gracchus arripuit. Nihil illi gentium feritas, Insanorumque, nam sic vocantur, immanitas montium profuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:35" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 513</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insarcio: <entryFree id="n23723" type="main" key="insarci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sarcĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stuff in</hi> (late Lat.): nummos in calceos sibi, Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insatiabilis: <entryFree id="n23724" type="main" key="insa^ti^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23724.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be satisfied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insatiable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acquirendi votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 125</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23724.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23724.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot cloy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that never produces satiety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est insatiabilior species,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 62, 155</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insătĭābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">insatiably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deflere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:907" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 907</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re inani desidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare memoriam sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes congerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ep. 4</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INSC" /></sense></entryFree>
insatiabilitas: <entryFree id="n23725" type="main" key="insa^ti^a_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insătĭābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insatiabilis</etym>, <sense id="n23725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insatiableness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 4, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insatiabiliter: <entryFree id="n23726" type="main" key="insa^ti^a_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insătĭābĭlĭter</orth>, v. insatiabilis <sense id="n23726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insatiatus: <entryFree id="n23727" type="main" key="insa^ti^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsatisfied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insatiate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor eundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:305" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 478</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insatietas: <entryFree id="n23728" type="hapax" key="insa^ti^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n23728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insatiateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy disposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum animis avidis atque insatietatibus neque lex est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insativus: <entryFree id="n23729" type="spur" key="insa^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătīvus</orth>, <itype>false reading for in sativis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 183</bibl>.</entryFree>
insaturabilis: <entryFree id="n23730" type="main" key="insa^tu^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătŭrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insatiable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abdomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:51:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 51, 110</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis humani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătŭrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">insatiably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annis praeteritis expleri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insaturatus: <entryFree id="n23731" type="main" key="insa^tu^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătŭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsatisfied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insatiate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noverca insaturata odiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Phaen. Arat. 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insaturus: <entryFree id="n23732" type="main" key="insa^tu^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sătŭrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insatiable</hi>, Coripp. Joann. 3, 368.</sense></entryFree>
insauciatus: <entryFree id="n23733" type="main" key="insauci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-saucĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not wounded,</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Dign. Sacerd. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inscalp: <entryFree id="n23734" type="main" key="inscalp"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscalp-</orth>, v. insculp-.</entryFree>
inscalptio: <entryFree id="n23735" type="main" key="inscalpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscalptĭo</orth>, v. insculptio.</entryFree>
inscendo: <entryFree id="n23736" type="main" key="inscendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscendo</orth>, <itype>scendi, scensum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-scando], <hi rend="ital">to step into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to climb up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23736.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inscenderet in rogum ardentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra pilam inscendat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 127, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigas Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud se inscendi ab alio (Bucephalus) nisi a rege passus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grabatulo inscenso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 122, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi amicam avectam scio, Inscendo,</quote> <trans><tr>I go on board ship</tr>, <tr>embark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23736.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">matronam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 249, 7.</sense></entryFree>
inscensio: <entryFree id="n23737" type="main" key="inscensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inscendo</etym>, <sense id="n23737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mounting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navem inscensio,</quote> <trans><tr>an embarking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscensus: <entryFree id="n23738" type="main" key="inscensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. inscendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23739" type="main" key="inscensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inscendo</etym>, <sense id="n23739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mounting</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscie: <entryFree id="n23740" type="main" key="insci^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inscius <sense id="n23740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insciens: <entryFree id="n23741" type="main" key="insci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unknowing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23741.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaware</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si peccavi, insciens feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me insciente esse factum,</quote> <trans><tr>without my knowing it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe jam Plus insciens quis fecit quam prudens boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sq.: me apsente atque insciente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum inscientem vultis contra foedera fecisse, an scientem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eorum verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:178 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 178 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23741.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi, sis, insciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inscĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unknowingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuba inflata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 10, 4</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscientia: <entryFree id="n23742" type="main" key="insci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n23742.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperience</hi> (cf. inscitia <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">in tantis tenebris erroris et inscientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23742.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas et inscientia ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23742.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 233</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23742.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ignorance</hi>, philosophically speaking; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. fundamental knowledge: de qua (natura Deorum) tam variae sunt doctissimorum hominum tamque discrepantes sententiae, ut magno argumento esse debeat, causam, i. e. principium philosophiae esse inscientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23742.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Blameworthy ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neglect</hi> (only in Tac.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inscitia): praecipientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidia ac inscientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscite: <entryFree id="n23743" type="main" key="insci_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inscitus <sense id="n23743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inscitia: <entryFree id="n23744" type="main" key="insci_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscītĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inscitus</etym>, <sense id="n23744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolidity</hi> in any thing (usu. with suggestion of blame; while inscientia is simply the absence of knowledge; but the distinction is neglected by Tacitus; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>).—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">erga</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: rei <cb n="INSC" /> publicae ut alienae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum verborumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitiam potius legionum quam audaciam increpans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidily</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">male mereri de immerente inscitia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex talenta magna dotis demam pro ista inscitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritate atque inscitia exercitum in locum praecipitem perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:17" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 33, 17</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pannoniorum inscitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princip. Hist. 319" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princip. Hist. 319</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23744.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ignorance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absence of knowledge</hi>, = inscientia (only in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">fore ut acerrimi militum per tenebras et inscitiam ceterorum occiderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: quo fidem inscitiae pararet, <hi rend="ital">to induce confidence in his ignorance</hi> of the crime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">isque illi finis inscitiae erga domum suam fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitia litterarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscitulus: <entryFree id="n23745" type="hapax" key="insci_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscītŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n23745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [inscitus], <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi>: ancillula, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 12, 21</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 386 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
inscitus: <entryFree id="n23746" type="main" key="insci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23746.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ignorant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexperienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid;</hi> freq. coupled with stultus (rare in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word of Plaut.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscita atque stulta mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 141</bibl>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum atque inscitum somniavi somnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est inscitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13</bibl></cit>. 36; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 62</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n23746.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid aliud indictum inscitumque dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inscītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clumsily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">comparari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inscite nugatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: inscitissime petit, Hyg. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inscius: <entryFree id="n23747" type="main" key="insci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ignorant</hi> of a thing (not used by Plaut. or Ter.; v. Ritschl, Proleg. p. 64 sq.; and cf. insciens); constr., <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, an <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or a <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23747.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinguere artificem ab inscio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is, quem vos ad mortem inscii misistis,</quote> <trans><tr>ignorantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscios inopinantesque Menapios oppresserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus insciis, neque suspicantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 37" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23747.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:292" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 85, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedulus inscius herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 66</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23747.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de malitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n23747.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: at enim scies ea, quae fuisti inscius, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 501, 18</bibl>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii flectere molem haud inscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:387 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 387 sq.</bibl></cit>: sutrinas facere inscius, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 17</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscii quid in Aeduis gereretur,</quote> <trans><tr>not knowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde vitam sumeret inscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 718</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n23747.5" n="B" level="2"> Special phrase: non sum inscius, <hi rend="ital">I am by no means unaware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I know very well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero sum inscius, esse utilitatem in historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 51</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n23747.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trames,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 170, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. nescius.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inscĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">ignorantly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inscribo: <entryFree id="n23748" type="main" key="inscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to inscribe</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23748.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in basi tropaeorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in statua inscripsit, Parenti optime merito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum monumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea inscribam brevi, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit inscriptum in fronte unius cujusque civis, quid de re publica sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes in animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si quae essent incisae aut inscriptae litterae, tollerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 53, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senarioli in ejus monumento inscripti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 26</bibl></cit> B. and K. (Klotz omits in): <cit><quote lang="la">Pan ... vix ulla inscribens terrae vestigia cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:328" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 328</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripti nomina regum flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23748.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish with an inscription</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae, quas tu inscribi jussisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:69:section=167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 69, § 167</bibl></cit>: aedes, <hi rend="ital">to write on a house that it is for sale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes venales hasce inscribit litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes mercede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: librum, <hi rend="ital">to inscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give a title to a book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (libellos) rhetoricos inscribunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 122</bibl></cit>: <pb n="963" /> <cb n="INSE" /> in eo libro, qui Oeconomicus inscribitur, <hi rend="ital">is entitled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripta lintea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>curtains used as signs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 168</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inscriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">title</hi>: alia inscripta nimis lepida, Gell. praef. 3. — </sense><sense id="n23748.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23748.4" n="A" level="2"> In g e n.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis suis sapientiam inscribit,</quote> <trans><tr>gives to his vices the name of wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23748.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23748.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus, quia tantummodo induit personam philosophi, et sibi ipse hoc nomen inscripsit,</quote> <trans><tr>has assigned</tr>, <tr>appropriated to himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos sceleri,</quote> <trans><tr>to ascribe crimes to the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea dextera leto Inscribenda tuo est,</quote> <trans><tr>thy death is to be ascribed to my hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23748.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, as if by an inscription: <cit><quote lang="la">sua quemque deorum inscribit facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versā pulvis inscribitur hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 478</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sua quemque deorum Inscribit facies,</quote> <trans><tr>makes known</tr>, <tr>characterizes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23748.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To brand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place a brand upon</hi>: vultus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naufrago stigmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:37:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripta ergastula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23748.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To subscribe an accusation</hi> (post-class.), Cod. 9, 35, 11.—</sense><sense id="n23748.10" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To write</hi> something <hi rend="ital">over</hi> an old writing, so that the latter is no longer legible (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de his, quae in testamento delentur, inducuntur, inscribuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscriptilis: <entryFree id="n23749" type="hapax" key="inscripti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scriptĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be written</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 413</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inscriptio: <entryFree id="n23750" type="main" key="inscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inscribo</etym>, <sense id="n23750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writing upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inscribing; an inscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">title</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nominis inscriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 20, 51</bibl></cit>: quod de inscriptione quaeris, non dubito, quin <foreign lang="greek">kaqh=kon</foreign> officium sit; <cit><quote lang="la">sed inscriptio plenior, de officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">An inscription</hi> on monuments: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc illa infelicis monumenti inscriptio, turba se medicorum periisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis,</quote> <trans><tr>a branding on the forehead</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">103</bibl>; so <number>plur.</number>, Sen. de Ira, 3, 3, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">servi, quibus stigmata inscripta sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">An accusation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">libellos inscriptionis deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inscriptum: <entryFree id="n23751" type="main" key="inscriptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscriptum</orth>, v. inscribo, I. B. <sense id="n23751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inscriptura: <entryFree id="n23752" type="hapax" key="inscriptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscriptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inscribo</etym>, <sense id="n23752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inscription</hi> (al. in scriptura), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inscriptus: <entryFree id="n23753" type="main" key="inscriptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inscriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inscribo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23754" type="main" key="inscriptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23754.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Unwritten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde et illa divisio est, alia esse scripta, alia inscripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:36" default="NO">7, 4, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23754.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not marked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entered at the custom-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contraband</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscriptum pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23754.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Concerning which nothing is written</hi> (in the statutes): maleficium, Sen. praef. 3 Excerpt. Controv.</sense></entryFree>
inscrutabilis: <entryFree id="n23755" type="main" key="inscru_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scrūtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-scrutor</etym>, <sense id="n23755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inscrutable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 106:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 106, 4</bibl></cit>; Hilar. Trin. 8, 38.</sense></entryFree>
inscrutor: <entryFree id="n23756" type="hapax" key="inscru_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-scrūtor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to search</hi> or <hi rend="ital">examine into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Homeri latentem prudentiam inscruteris altius (al. scruteris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insculpo: <entryFree id="n23757" type="main" key="insculpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sculpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">inscalp-</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carve in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to engrave.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23757.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23757.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">summam patrimonii saxo (shortly before, incidere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elogium tumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incisa et insculpta sunt publicis aeternisque monumentis praetoria ornamenta Pallantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus luxuriantis aetatis signaturas pretiosis gemmis coepit insculpere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23757.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">columna aenea insculptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23757.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (with <case>abl.</case> of manner): <cit><quote lang="la">ara cum ingenti titulo Punicis Graecisque litteris insculpto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46, 16</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23757.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to engrave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura insculpsit in mentibus, ut deos aeternos et beatos haberemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus enim innatum est et in animo quasi insculptum, esse deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insculptio: <entryFree id="n23758" type="main" key="insculpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insculptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insculpo</etym>, <sense id="n23758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carving</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insculptus: <entryFree id="n23759" type="main" key="insculptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insculptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from insculpo.</entryFree>
insecabilis: <entryFree id="n23760" type="main" key="inse^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be cut up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inseparable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indivisible</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>atoms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:13" default="NO">3, 3, 13</bibl>. <cb n="INSE" /></sense></entryFree>
inseco: <entryFree id="n23761" type="main" key="inse^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕco</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivam acuta harundine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora mortuorum ad scrutandos morbos,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insecandi sunt favi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (subtemen) insecti pectine dentes,</quote> <trans><tr>cut in</tr>, <tr>notched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 58</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">insectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animale), <hi rend="ital">an insect; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:96 al" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 28, 33, § 96 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23762" type="main" key="inse^co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕquo</orth>, <itype>insexi</itype>, old form for <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕquor</orth>, <sense id="n23762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pursue the narration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare;</hi> so <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: insece, Musa, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 332 Vahl.): virum mihi, Camena, insece versutum, Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 5</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi>: insexit, dixerit, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: insecenda, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
insecta: <entryFree id="n23763" type="main" key="insecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insecta</orth>, v. 1. inseco <sense id="n23763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insectanter: <entryFree id="n23764" type="hapax" key="insectanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insectanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>insector</etym>, <sense id="n23764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">harshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bitterly</hi> (with graviter): <cit><quote lang="la">vituperari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insectatio: <entryFree id="n23765" type="main" key="insecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pursuing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursuit</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n23765.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23765.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pursuing with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a censuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">railing at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deriding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulting</hi>: tanta est hominum insolentia et nostri insectatio, Brut. ap. Ep. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 34, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum et morum alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insectationibus petere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:86" default="NO">11, 1, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod insectationis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insectator: <entryFree id="n23766" type="main" key="insecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a persecutor</hi> (very rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n23766.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23766.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a censurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insectio: <entryFree id="n23767" type="gloss" key="insecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. inseco</etym>, <sense id="n23767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narration</hi>, i. q. narratio, acc. to a remark of <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11" default="NO">11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insecto: <entryFree id="n23768" type="main" key="insecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, a rare form for insector, <sense id="n23768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos insectabit lapidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 61</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: insectatus, <hi rend="ital">pursued</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 71, 4.</sense></entryFree>
insector: <entryFree id="n23769" type="main" key="insector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insector</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n23769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a. freq.</hi> [insequor], <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23769.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">impios agitant insectanturque furiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verberibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to pursue with blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23769.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: assiduis herbam insectabere rastris, <hi rend="ital">pursue the weeds with diligent hoes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">diligently extirpate them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23769.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rail at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigh against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak ill of</hi> (with exagitare): <cit><quote lang="la">indices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insector ultro, atque insto accusatori: insector, inquam, et flagito testes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbius in aliquem invehi insectarique vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inimice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audaciam improborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librariorum inscientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextam demissam ad talos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:39 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 39 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum amissi corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>to reproach</tr>, <tr>upbraid with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de legitima insectandi alicujus causa composita oratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsceno nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insectum: <entryFree id="n23770" type="main" key="insectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. inseco <sense id="n23770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insectura: <entryFree id="n23771" type="hapax" key="insectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> [1. inseco), <sense id="n23771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incision</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insectus: <entryFree id="n23772" type="main" key="insectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. inseco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23773" type="main" key="insectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-seco</etym>, for non sectus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
insecundus: <entryFree id="n23774" type="main" key="inse^cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕcundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncomplying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus, insecundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insecutio: <entryFree id="n23775" type="hapax" key="inse^cu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕcūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insequor</etym>, <sense id="n23775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pursuing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insecutor: <entryFree id="n23776" type="main" key="inse^cu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕcūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pursuer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persecutor</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mag. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustratis insecutoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
insedabilis: <entryFree id="n23777" type="main" key="inse_da_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sēdābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sedo</etym>, <sense id="n23777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be stayed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessant</hi>: insedabilis, <foreign lang="greek">a)kata/paustos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insēdābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unquenchably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incessantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inseducibilis: <entryFree id="n23778" type="main" key="inse_du_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insēdūcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-seduco</etym>, <sense id="n23778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be drawn away</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 2, p. 188. <cb n="INSE" /></sense></entryFree>
insedulus: <entryFree id="n23779" type="gloss" key="inse_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sēdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not zealous</hi>: insedulus, <foreign lang="greek">aspou/dastos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insegnis: <entryFree id="n23780" type="gloss" key="insegnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-segnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>: insegnis, <foreign lang="greek">a)dranh/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insemel: <entryFree id="n23781" type="main" key="inse^me^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕmĕl</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, Flor. prooem. § 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insemino: <entryFree id="n23782" type="main" key="inse_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sēmĭno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to implant</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabem et morbos visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ex caelestium imbrium conceptionibus inseminata,</quote> <trans><tr>impregnated</tr>, <tr>fertilized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex conventu Jovis inseminati et nati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insemitatio: <entryFree id="n23783" type="gloss" key="inse_mi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insēmĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (2. in-semita], <sense id="n23783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pathlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impassableness</hi>: insemitatio, <foreign lang="greek">a)nodi/a,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insenescibilis: <entryFree id="n23784" type="gloss" key="inse^nesci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕnescĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-senesco</etym>, <sense id="n23784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not growing old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undecaying</hi>: insenescibilis, <foreign lang="greek">a)gh/raos, a)gh/ratos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insenesco: <entryFree id="n23785" type="main" key="inse^nesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕnesco</orth>, <itype>nui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow old in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> a thing; constr. with <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">insenuit Libris et curis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis actionum partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insensatus: <entryFree id="n23786" type="main" key="insensa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sensātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irrational</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 43 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insensātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:Sir. 12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. Sir. 12, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insensibilis: <entryFree id="n23787" type="main" key="insensi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sensĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be felt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperceptible</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n23787.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>. — As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insensĭbĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things of no account</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23787.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Things imperceptible</hi>, Apul. Asclep. 19, p. 87. — </sense><sense id="n23787.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">incomprehensible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inenarrabile esse ait, et propemodum insensibile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23787.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 2 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insensĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">insensibly</hi>, Cassiod.</sense></entryFree>
insensibilitas: <entryFree id="n23788" type="main" key="insensi^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insensĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insensibilis</etym>, <sense id="n23788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insensibility</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Bono Mort. 7, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insensilis: <entryFree id="n23789" type="main" key="insensi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sensĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperceptible</hi>, = insensibilis: <cit><quote lang="la">principia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 866</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:888" default="NO" valid="yes">888</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insensualis: <entryFree id="n23790" type="hapax" key="insensu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sensŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insensualitas: <entryFree id="n23791" type="main" key="insensu^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insensŭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insensualis</etym>, <sense id="n23791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insensibility</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. contr. Faust. 15, 4.</sense></entryFree>
inseparabilis: <entryFree id="n23792" type="main" key="inse_pa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sēpărābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inseparable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 118:85" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 118, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trinitas inseparabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 15:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insēpărā-bĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inseparably</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conexa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inseparabilitas: <entryFree id="n23793" type="main" key="inse_pa^ra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insēpărābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inseparabilis</etym>, <sense id="n23793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inseparableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inseparability</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 15:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 15, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 29:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inseparatus: <entryFree id="n23794" type="main" key="inse_pa^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sēpărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not separate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inseptus: <entryFree id="n23795" type="main" key="inseptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-septus</orth>, v. insaeptus.</entryFree>
insepultus: <entryFree id="n23796" type="main" key="inse^pultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕpultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sepultus</etym>, <sense id="n23796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unburied</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acervi civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:99" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insepultos projecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23796.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">without burial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 14</bibl></cit>: sepultura, <hi rend="ital">a burial without the customary funeral rites</hi>, and therefore undeserving the name of a burial (imitation of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta/fos a)/tafos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl> (but sepulta is the true reading, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 12, 33</bibl> B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
inseque: <entryFree id="n23797" type="main" key="inse^que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕque</orth>, v. 2. inseco.</entryFree>
insequens: <entryFree id="n23798" type="main" key="inse^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from insequor.</entryFree>
insequenter: <entryFree id="n23799" type="hapax" key="inse^quenter1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insequor, <sense id="n23799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23800" type="hapax" key="inse^quenter2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕquenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-sequor</etym>, <sense id="n23800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not in the proper order of succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconnectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">particula posita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:29:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insequor: <entryFree id="n23801" type="main" key="inse^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus</itype> (quūtus), 3, <sense id="n23801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to follow after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a person or thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n23801.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23801.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus huic, longo sed proximus intervallo Insequitur Salius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientem lumine pinum,</quote> <trans><tr>with her eyes follows the flying ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 468</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23801.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press upon</hi>: <pb n="964" /> <cb n="INSE" /> gens eadem quae te bello Insequitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:13" default="NO">7, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostem insequendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias Troiae cineres atque ossa peremptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem gladio stricto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.—</sense><sense id="n23801.4" n="C" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">verb. fin.</hi> rare; cf. <pos>P. a.</pos> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc proximo saeculo Themistocles insecutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:10:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 10, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23801.5" n="II"
