level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23801.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">improborum facta suspicie insequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23801.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23801.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strive after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero te rhetoricis quibusdam libris insequor, ut erudiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23801.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergam atque insequar longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus et alterius lentum convellere vimen Insequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23801.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overtake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mors insecuta est Gracchum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:29:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 29, 62</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23801.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pursue in a hostile manner with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines benevolos contumeliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irridendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore ac minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 29, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 53, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23801.12" n="5" level="3"> Of order or succession, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremam litteram detrahebant, nisi vocalis insequebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagium insequentis casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, of time, <hi rend="ital">following</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48:10" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei insequentis pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte insequenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:23:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insequentium aetatum principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23801.13" n="2" level="3"> Of logical order: <cit><quote lang="la">ex prioribus geometria probat insequentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:17 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 17 al.</bibl> — * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĕquenter</orth>, i. q. protinus, deinceps, <hi rend="ital">thereupon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 376, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inserabiliter: <entryFree id="n23802" type="hapax" key="inse^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-sera</etym>, <sense id="n23802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so as not to be unlocked</hi>: obstruere, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 100 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
inserenus: <entryFree id="n23803" type="hapax" key="inse^re_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overcast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insero: <entryFree id="n23804" type="main" key="inse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, sĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-, 1. sero</etym>, <sense id="n23804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plant in; to ingraft</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23804.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pirum bonam in pirum silvaticam,</quote> <trans><tr>to ingraft</tr>, <tr>graft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fissā modo cortice virgam Inserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 631</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inseritur et nucis arbutus horrida fetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 69</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum Vergilius insitam nucibus arbutum dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 17, § 57</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23804.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to implant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num qua tibi vitiorum inseverit olim Natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia herbis invisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 6, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos corporibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to unite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 12, 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grafted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23804.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23804.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">discordantem utero suo generis alieni stirpem insitam recipere,</quote> <trans><tr>a hybrid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23804.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">implanted by nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inborn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">O generosam stirpem et tamquam in unam arborem plura genera, sic in istam domum multorum insitam atque illigatam sapientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 213</bibl></cit>: reliqua est ea causa, quae non jam recepta, sed innata; <cit><quote lang="la">neque delata ad me, sed in animo sensuque meo penitus affixa atque insita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deorum cognitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam penitus insita opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notio quasi naturalis atque insita in animis nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menti cognitionis amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc naturā est insitum, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.— In gen., <hi rend="ital">taken in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incorporated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admitted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adopted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex deserto Gavii horreo in Calatinos Atilios insitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insitus et adoptivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23805" type="main" key="inse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sĕrŭi, sertum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-, 2. sero</etym>, <sense id="n23805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">introduce into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to insert</hi> (class.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n23805.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23805.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">collum in laqueum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos in pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in tentoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas aureis soleis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces longuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtegmen radiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in avium nidis aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23805.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to ingraft</hi>:<cb n="INSE" />  quidquid inserueris, vimine diligenter ligato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculus insertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23805.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mix</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mingle with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amputanda plura sunt illi aetati, quam inserenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus est, quod non opinio genuit, sed quaedam innata vis inseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiae jocos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:444" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo minimis etiam rebus prava religio inserit Deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contiones directas operi suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae rerum magnitudini hoc inserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec libello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 18</bibl></cit>: manus, <hi rend="ital">to set one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hands to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 552</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos sceleri,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw into</tr>, <tr>involve in crime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 322" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina alienae gentis Aeacidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignobilitatem suam magnis nominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to mingle with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inserentibus se centurionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se bellis civilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 117</bibl></cit>: civium numero, <hi rend="ital">to reckon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enroll among</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liviorum familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellis et concilio Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vitae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to preserve alive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:72" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 72</bibl></cit>: nomen famae, <hi rend="ital">to attach to fame</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to render celebrated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inserpo: <entryFree id="n23806" type="main" key="inserpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-serpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crcep on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> any thing; only trop.; constr. with <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam somnus avaris Inserpit curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:340" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei lanugo malis inserpebat,</quote> <trans><tr>covered over his cheeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 189 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inserta: <entryFree id="n23807" type="main" key="inserta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inserta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. insero</etym>, <sense id="n23807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">frugalitas inserta est rumoris boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insertatio: <entryFree id="n23808" type="hapax" key="inserta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insertātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inserto</etym>, <sense id="n23808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inserting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inserticius: <entryFree id="n23809" type="gloss" key="inserti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insertīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. insero</etym>, <sense id="n23809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be inserted</hi>: inserticius, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkentrh/simos, e)nta/cimos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insertim: <entryFree id="n23810" type="spur" key="insertim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insertim</orth>, false read. for inserti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 115</bibl>.</entryFree>
insertio: <entryFree id="n23811" type="main" key="inserti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. insero</etym>, <sense id="n23811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grafting</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleastri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insertivus: <entryFree id="n23812" type="main" key="inserti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insertīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafted;</hi> only trop. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an illegitimate posterity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Decl. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inserto: <entryFree id="n23813" type="main" key="inserto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inserto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n23813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to put into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insert;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">clipeoque sinistram Insertabam aptans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras catenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:460" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insertans commissuris secures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insertus: <entryFree id="n23814" type="main" key="insertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. insero.</entryFree>
inservio: <entryFree id="n23815" type="main" key="inservi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-servĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (archaic forms, inservibas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 59</bibl>: <sense id="n23815.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inservibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:341" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 341</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and (rarely) <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be devoted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attached to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be submissive to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi> (syn.: deservio, ministro); with <case>dat.</case>, rarely with <case>acc.</case> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23815.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium meum amico suo video inservire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo plurimum sperant, ei potissimum inserviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebi, cui ad eam diem summa ope inservitum erat,</quote> <trans><tr>who had been treated with the utmost deference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus definitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:25:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">to be devoted to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take care of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23815.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si illum inservibis solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 105</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est a me inservitum temporis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23815.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inservientium regum ditissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>vassal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inservo: <entryFree id="n23816" type="main" key="inservo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-servo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n23816.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To attend to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> (a favorite word of Statius): <cit><quote lang="la">gemit, inservante noverca, Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:886" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 886</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 935</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23816.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To keep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae volitantes vires integras inservabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 15, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insessio: <entryFree id="n23817" type="main" key="insessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insideo</etym>, <sense id="n23817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sitting down</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">hostium insessio, id est hostilis circundatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 21, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insessor: <entryFree id="n23818" type="main" key="insessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a besetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupant</hi> (very rare); <cit><quote lang="la">of a ship,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a waylayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:48" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: insessores, latrones, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll.: quod circa vias insidientur sedentes. <cb n="INSI" /></sense></entryFree>
insessus: <entryFree id="n23819" type="main" key="insessus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from insideo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23820" type="hapax" key="insessus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n23820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsettled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without a permanent dwelling</hi>: gentes, Sic. Fl. de Cond. Agr. p. 3.</sense></entryFree>
insexit: <entryFree id="n23821" type="main" key="insexit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insexit</orth>, v. 2. inseco.</entryFree>
insibilator: <entryFree id="n23822" type="main" key="insi_bi^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insībĭlātor</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>insibilo</etym>, <sense id="n23822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that breathes in by hissing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">venenorum insibilator serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joh. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joh. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insibilo: <entryFree id="n23823" type="main" key="insi_bi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sībĭlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whistle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rustle in</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:616" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erinys atros insibilat ore tumores,</quote> <trans><tr>hisses in</tr>, <tr>breathes in</tr>, <tr>with a hissing noise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:626" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 626</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insiccabilis: <entryFree id="n23824" type="hapax" key="insicca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-siccābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be dried</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insiccatus: <entryFree id="n23825" type="main" key="insicca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-siccātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not dried up</hi> (only in Statius): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera cruore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:364" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insicia: <entryFree id="n23826" type="main" key="insi^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">īsĭc-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inseco</etym>, <sense id="n23826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force-meat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dish of minced meat</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n23826.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form insicia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 110</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n23826.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form insicium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insiciarius: <entryFree id="n23827" type="main" key="insi^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>insicia</etym>, <sense id="n23827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forcemeat-maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insiciatus: <entryFree id="n23828" type="hapax" key="insi^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭcĭātus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">isĭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffed with force-meat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insiciolum: <entryFree id="n23829" type="main" key="insi^ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭcĭŏlum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">isĭcĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>insicium</etym>, <sense id="n23829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little force-meat</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">porcina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:3" default="NO">5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insicium: <entryFree id="n23830" type="main" key="insi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭcĭum</orth>, v. insicia.</entryFree>
insideo: <entryFree id="n23831" type="main" key="insi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [in-sedeo], <hi rend="ital">to sit in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> any thing; mostly with <case>dat.</case> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23831.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23831.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru insidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23831.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To settle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Lydia quondam jugis insedit Etruscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 479</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23831.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be seated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stamped in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adhere to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in locis semen insedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longus morbus, cum penitus insedit,</quote> <trans><tr>when it has become deeply seated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidens capulo manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>keeping firm hold of the handle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil quisquam unquam, me audiente, egit orator, quod non in memoria mea penitus insederit,</quote> <trans><tr>remained thoroughly fixed in my mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidebat in ejus mente species eloquentiae,</quote> <trans><tr>was firmly stamped on his mind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas, quae penitus in omni sensu implicata insidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hic fervor concitatioque animi inveteraverit, et tamquam in venis medullisque insederit,</quote> <trans><tr>has firmly seated itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23831.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be situated upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take place upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23831.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Joppe insidet collem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 69</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23831.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take possession of</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidere vias examina infantium solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aventinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:13" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 9</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">medium mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem Capitolii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea loca,</quote> <trans><tr>inhabit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 62</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viaeque omnes hostium praesidiis insidentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus circa insessus ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per montes praesidiis nostris insessos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insessus iterum Alpibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insessum diris avibus Capitolium,</quote> <trans><tr>occupied as a perch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insidiae: <entryFree id="n23832" type="main" key="insi^di^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number> (in <number>sing.</number> insidia prima, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 75</bibl> P.) [insideo], <sense id="n23832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ambush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ambuscade</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23832.1" n="I" level="1"> Lit </sense><sense id="n23832.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sustinuerant primos impetus insidiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites procedere longius jussi, donec insidiae coorirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23832.3" n="B" level="2"> Of place: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte in insidias devenero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa aenea in insidiis ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in insidiis collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrare insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n23832.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To lay an ambush for any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias dare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere vitae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere vitae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias penitus abstrusas ponere contra aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">struere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compo nere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit> (3, 30), 19: componere<pb n="965" /> <cb n="INSI" />  alicui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre ovilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:40" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avibus moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 271</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23832.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In <case>abl.</case> alone, <case>abl.</case> with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, or <case>acc.</case> with <hi rend="ital">per</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by artifice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stratagem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insidiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellus insidiis interfectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per insidias quempiam interficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per insidias circumvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex insidiis, sed aperte ac palam elaborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insidiis invadere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23832.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crafty device</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis insidiarum ad capiendas aures adhiberi videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositae orationis insidiis fidem alicujus attentare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 61, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:416" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post obitum parentis periculo insidiarum subjectus pupillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:181" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insidianter: <entryFree id="n23833" type="hapax" key="insi^di^anter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>insidior</etym>, <sense id="n23833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">craftily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insidiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidianter speculati (al. insidiantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insidiator: <entryFree id="n23834" type="main" key="insi^di^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier lying in ambush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:18" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23834.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who lies in wait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lurker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waylayer</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro collocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insidiatrix: <entryFree id="n23835" type="hapax" key="insi^di^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insidiator</etym>, <sense id="n23835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that lies in wait</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insidio: <entryFree id="n23836" type="hapax" key="insi^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n23836.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
insidior: <entryFree id="n23837" type="main" key="insi^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n23837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form insidiaverint for insidiati erunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28, § 11</bibl>) [insidiae], <hi rend="ital">to lie in ambush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie in wait for;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n23837.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam diu mihi, Catilina, insidiatus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:14:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legatis insidiandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 21, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23837.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno maritorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch for</tr>, <tr>seize upon the favorable moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 15</bibl></cit>: temporibus, <hi rend="ital">to watch the changes of the times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn them to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own advantage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insidiose: <entryFree id="n23838" type="main" key="insi^di^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insidiosus <sense id="n23838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insidiosus: <entryFree id="n23839" type="main" key="insi^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insidiae</etym>, <sense id="n23839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cunning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insidious</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23839.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quis insidiosior unquam fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23839.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">Capraria insidiosa naufragiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula Circes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 28</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭdĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">cunningly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insidiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gratiam rediit cum illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me insidiosissime tractavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insido: <entryFree id="n23840" type="main" key="insi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sīdo</orth>, <itype>sēdi</itype> (<sense id="n23840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> insidi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 6, 4</bibl>), <itype>sessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sit down in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to settle on;</hi> constr. with <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23840.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23840.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">apes floribus insidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 708</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscia Dido, Insidat quantus miserae deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 719</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">volucres metuunt insidere ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 407</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:151" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex insiditur astris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera "i" sibi insidit, coniicit enim est ab illo jacit,</quote> <trans><tr>coalesces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitos membris,</quote> <trans><tr>sink into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23840.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep possession of</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n23840.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquis silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 531</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23840.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aventinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad itinera insidenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus ab hoste insessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes insessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo jugum melius aptum cervicibus insidat,</quote> <trans><tr>may sit more closely on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23840.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be rooted in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adhere to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in memoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insedit in animo oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi insedisset suspicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macula insedit in nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 3</bibl></cit>: dum illa verba memoriae insidant, <hi rend="ital">settle</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">remain fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rooted in the memory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insigne: <entryFree id="n23841" type="main" key="insigne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insigne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>insignis</etym>, <sense id="n23841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signal;</hi> <hi rend="ital">a distinctive mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a badge of office</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23841.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat insigne, eum facere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva singulare est insigne ejus gymnasii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos in Aegypto etiam numinis vice colitur: Apim vocant. Insigne ei in dextro latere candicans macula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 46, 71, § 184</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi haberent honores ... sibi triumphos, sibi alia praeclarae laudis insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23841.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badge of office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">honor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a decoration</hi>: bulla erat indicium et insigne <cb n="INSI" /> fortunae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>.—Esp. in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">insignia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regalia</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sedebat cum purpura, et sceptro, et insignibus illis regiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontificalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 7</bibl></cit>: militaria, <hi rend="ital">ornaments</hi>, probably <hi rend="ital">on the helmets of the officers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horum (mundi et caeli) insignia, sol, luna, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>the costume of a public singer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 227</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23841.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A standard</hi>: navem Bruti, quae ex insigni facile agnosci poterat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the flag</hi> of the admiral's ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23841.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A signal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praetoria nave insigne nocturnum trium luminum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23841.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia virtutis multi sine virtute adsecuti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis lumina et quodam modo insignia,</quote> <trans><tr>brilliant passages</tr>, <tr>gems</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit> (v. the context): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum et sententiarum insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 96 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
insigniarius: <entryFree id="n23842" type="gloss" key="insigni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>insigne</etym>, <sense id="n23842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeper of insignia</hi>: insigniarius, <foreign lang="greek">o(plopa/roxos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insignificativus: <entryFree id="n23843" type="main" key="insigni^fi^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-signĭfĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. modus) [2. in-significo], <sense id="n23843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the insignificative</hi>, a name given by some grammarians to the <hi rend="ital">infinitive</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 331</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
insignio: <entryFree id="n23844" type="main" key="insigni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n23844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> insignibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 790</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 56</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>insignis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to put a mark upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mark; to distinguish</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): pueri insigniti, <hi rend="ital">marked with some bodily defect</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=375:19" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 375, 19</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:Mil. 3:1:127" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 127</bibl> Weise): <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulli insigniuntur barba gemina inferiori labro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorem fucatis et meretriciis vestibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>: nec insigniri, nec misceri omnibus, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis annus funeribus et cladibus insigniretur,</quote> <trans><tr>was distinguished by</tr>, <tr>remarkable for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make known</tr>, <tr>to name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">insig-nītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n23844.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Marked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">englyphus, id est bene insignitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 16, § <cit><quote lang="la">42: utendum imaginibus agentibus, acribus, insignitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conformatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notae veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23844.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notable</hi>: injuriae, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominia (al. insignior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus nomen ab hac recentiore insignitius fabula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23844.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Arrayed with banners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with standards</hi>: insigneita fere tum milia militum octo duxit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1, p. 556</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 336 Vahl.).— </sense><sense id="n23844.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insignīta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">bruises</hi>, <hi rend="ital">black and blue marks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 4, 5, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:128" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 105, § 128</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insignītē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">remarkably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi insignite facta est magna injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignite improbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 23, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare ac vituperari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 349</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insignis: <entryFree id="n23845" type="main" key="insignis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-signum</etym>, <sense id="n23845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distinguished by a mark; remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi> (class.): insignes appellantur boves, qui in femine et in pede album habent, quasi insigniti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis insignis et albo, i. e. maculis albis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insigni eum veste adornavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:31:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 31, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deformitatem puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo omnibus insignis notis turpitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans><tr>illustrious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā cantabitur urbe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>notorious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debilitate aliqua corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>remarkable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignus genere et praeclaro nomine tantum Insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:32" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus studium insigne fuit erga me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>, B, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 29, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum pagina,</quote> <trans><tr>glorious</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: jamdiu causam quaerebat senex, quamobrem insigne aliquid faceret <cb n="INSI" /> his, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of punishing them severely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 31</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis ventos anteire lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:561" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 561</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insignĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">remarkably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinarily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos diligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus insigniter cristatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere unum aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba nove et insigniter dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insignite: <entryFree id="n23846" type="main" key="insigni_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insignio, <sense id="n23846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insigniter: <entryFree id="n23847" type="main" key="insigni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insignis <sense id="n23847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insignitor: <entryFree id="n23848" type="main" key="insigni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>insignio</etym>, <sense id="n23848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an engraver</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 4.</sense></entryFree>
insignitus: <entryFree id="n23849" type="main" key="insigni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insignītus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from insignio.</entryFree>
insigno: <entryFree id="n23850" type="gloss" key="insigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-signo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to engrave</hi>: insigno, <foreign lang="greek">e)gxara/ssw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insilia: <entryFree id="n23851" type="main" key="insi^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> [insilio], <sense id="n23851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the treadle</hi> of a weaver's loom, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insilio: <entryFree id="n23852" type="main" key="insi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (insilivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 9</bibl>: insilii, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 349</bibl>; <sense id="n23852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> insilibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11, 7</bibl>), <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>in-salio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to leap into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spring at;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, with the simple <case>acc.</case>, with <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class., but not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n23852.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23852.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e navi in scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites qui in phalangas insilirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23852.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 5, 3</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to spring upon one</tr>, <tr>to attack him</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 203, 3.—</sense><sense id="n23852.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prorae, puppique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo centauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:345" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 152</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23852.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo insilit saltu,</quote> <trans><tr>leaps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insilit huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 731</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23852.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes in jugum insilit,</quote> <trans><tr>mounts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl></cit>: metuo, ne hodie in malum cruciatum insiliamus, <hi rend="ital">I fear we shall dance on the cross to-day</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shall be crucified</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insimilo: <entryFree id="n23853" type="main" key="insi^mi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭmĭlo</orth>, v. insimulo.</entryFree>
