insimul: <entryFree id="n23854" type="main" key="insi^mul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĭmul</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n23854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi> (postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">first in Statius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 36</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:20:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 20, 1</bibl>, read insemel).</sense></entryFree>
insimulatio: <entryFree id="n23855" type="main" key="insi^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭmŭlātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">insĭmĭl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insimulo</etym>, <sense id="n23855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a charge</hi> against one, <hi rend="ital">an accusation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in falsam atque iniquam probrorum insimulationem vocabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insimulator: <entryFree id="n23856" type="main" key="insi^mu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭmŭlātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">insĭmĭl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accuser</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 293, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insimulatus: <entryFree id="n23857" type="main" key="insi^mu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭmŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-simulo</etym>, <sense id="n23857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undisguised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfeigned</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 18, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insimulo: <entryFree id="n23858" type="main" key="insi^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a plausible charge</hi> (true or false) <hi rend="ital">against a person</hi> before a tribunal; <hi rend="ital">to make suspected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blame</hi>, esp. falsely; <hi rend="ital">to invent a charge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bear false witness against</hi> (syn.: accuso, incuso, arguo). </sense><sense id="n23858.1" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non facit tu male facis, quae insontem insimules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tu me etiam insimulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum quemquam insimulare falso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tu me etiam insimulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hunc) velut insidiis ejus petitus sceleste insimulare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus falsis insimulasse virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23858.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of person</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gen. of the charge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruo uxorem insimulat probri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se peccati, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Verrem avaritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vercingetorix proditionis insimulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proditionis insimulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum insimulabis avaritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetundarum insimulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Halm.—</sense><sense id="n23858.3" n="3" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">queruntur, quod eos insimulemus omnia incerta dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insimulant hominem fraudandi causa discessisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:24:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 24, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quod illum durum insimulat, id non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumore tenus insimulatus fovisse partes hostiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcibiades absens insimulatur Athenis mysteria Cereris enuntiavisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23858.4" n="4" level="3"> With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: mirum'st <pb n="966" /> <cb n="INSI" /> sic (eum) me insimulare falso facinus tam malum, Flaut. Am. 2, 2, 229: <cit><quote lang="la">quod illum insimulat durum, id non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23858.5" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. of the charge</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">non istuc quod tu insimulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit> (Bothe and Wagner, quo): <cit><quote lang="la">istuc facinus, quod tu insimulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 188</bibl></cit> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod ego injuratus insimulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:41:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 41, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 59, § 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque aliud quam patientia aut pudor, quod legato pepercisset, insimulari posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 20, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23858.6" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. of manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateri facinus insimulati falso crimine senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 21</bibl> (supra).</sense></entryFree>
insincerus: <entryFree id="n23859" type="main" key="insince_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sincērus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adulterated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiled; not honest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">candid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insincere</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n23859.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <trans><tr>imperfect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23859.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: oblatio, Ambros. de Cain et Abel, 2, 6, § 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:in Psa. 118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 11, § 20.</sense></entryFree>
insinuatio: <entryFree id="n23860" type="main" key="insi^nu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭnŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insinuo</etym>, <sense id="n23860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an entrance through a narrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crooked way.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23860.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ponti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 397</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23860.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23860.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An insinuating</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ingratiating one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self into the favor of others</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exordium in duas partes dividitur, in principium et insinuationem.... Insinuatio est oratio, quadam dissimulatione et circuitione obscure subiens auditoris animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23860.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A notification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publication</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 54, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insinuator: <entryFree id="n23861" type="main" key="insi^nu^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭnŭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an introducer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insinuatrix: <entryFree id="n23862" type="main" key="insi^nu^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭnŭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insinuator</etym>, <sense id="n23862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that introduces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes known</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">rei novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 110:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 110, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insinuo: <entryFree id="n23863" type="main" key="insi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n23863.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23863.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thrust into the bosom</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sicine vacuus et otiosus insinuatis manibus ambulabis,</quote> <trans><tr>with folded arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum in sinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23863.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring in by windings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turnings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to insinuate into; to cause</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">to get to</hi> a place <hi rend="ital">by windings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turnings;</hi> and, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to cause to arrive at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get to</hi> a place. </sense><sense id="n23863.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem terris,</quote> <trans><tr>to land</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum aestum per saepta domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 860</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani quacumque data intervalla essent, insinuabant ordines suos,</quote> <trans><tr>pushed forward their files into the open spaces of the enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et (tibi) omni tempore tam faciles insinuentur opes,</quote> <trans><tr>come to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 28.— </sense><sense id="n23863.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wind one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal into; to insinuate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ingratiate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se inter equitum turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā te insinuaveris, retro via repetenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Romanus) insinuasset se inter corpus armaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua se inter valles flumen insinuat,</quote> <trans><tr>winds along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigris Persico mari se insinuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23863.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make favorably known to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to introduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23863.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusto insinuatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est quod penitus illos animo Caesaris insinuavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam moresque feris mentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:de Orig. Gent. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> de Orig. Gent. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23863.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., reflex. with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n23863.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his nos rebus insinuabimus ad causam,</quote> <trans><tr>will make our way to</tr>, <tr>get to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in antiquam philosophiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in familiaritatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in amicitiam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:68:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 68, § 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in familiarem usum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in eorum sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23863.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidus ille ne se insinuet, studiose cavendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem qua te insinuaveris via retro repetenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter dato loco cum se insinuasset, Auct. B. Alex. 52, 2: praefecto regis se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebi se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23863.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To introduce to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">initiate into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adest tibi dies, quo per istas meas manus piissimis sacrorum arcanis insinueris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23863.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem suam heredibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:11:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 11, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Nam. 1, 590</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23863.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steal into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive at;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> or <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: inde in amicitiam<cb n="INSI" />  insinuavit cum matre et mecum simul. Blanditiis, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus insinuare in causam,</quote> <trans><tr>to penetrate thoroughly into</tr>, <tr>to acquire a complete knowledge of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad causam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsius consuetudinem insinuabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novus per pectora cunctis Insinuat pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiaeque urbes dextram insinuantis in undam,</quote> <trans><tr>winding</tr>, <tr>reaching to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 602</bibl></cit>: et blandiri suppliciter et subtiliter insinuare eis, a quibus, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">to steal into favor with</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insipidus: <entryFree id="n23864" type="main" key="insi^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sapidus</etym>, <sense id="n23864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tasteless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi> (late Lat.): sapor, Firm. Math. 2, 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 39, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insipiens: <entryFree id="n23865" type="main" key="insi^pi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sĭpĭens</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">insăp-</orth>, Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 53</bibl>; p. 304, 16 Bait.), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sapiens</etym>, <sense id="n23865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego insipiens nova nunc facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insipiens fortunatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo insipientium (opp. sapiens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 50</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis homost me insipientior, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego insipientior quam illi ipsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insipientissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭpĭen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unwisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a me factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insipientia: <entryFree id="n23866" type="main" key="insi^pi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭpĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insipiens</etym>, <sense id="n23866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of wisdom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">folly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit, ut sapientia sanitas sit animi, insipientia autem quasi insanitas quaedam, quae est insania eademque dementia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insipo: <entryFree id="n23867" type="main" key="insi^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (<sense id="n23867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. pass.</hi> insipitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 105</bibl> Müll.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to throw in</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 85</bibl>: ligna, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 10</bibl>, n. 3 (Com. Fragm. v. 50, 86 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
insisto: <entryFree id="n23868" type="main" key="insisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set foot upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tread</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">press upon;</hi> constr. mostly with <case>dat.</case>, also with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> or <case>acc.</case>, or the simple <case>acc.</case> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23868.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23868.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n23868.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec desunt villae quae secutae fluminis amoenitatem margini insistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut proximi jacentibus insisterent,</quote> <trans><tr>stepped upon them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternis pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres metuunt insistere ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (saxo) institerat frustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:150" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:96" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamoso circo,</quote> <trans><tr>occupy a place in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">insistebat in manu Cereris dextra simulacrum Victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:49:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 49, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingulus australis, in quo qui insistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse non insistere in terra poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinistrum pedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 125</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus repente super galeam insistit,</quote> <trans><tr>lights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <trans><tr>to step upon</tr>, <tr>to tread the threshold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia nuda sinistri pedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primis infans vestigia plantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23868.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n23868.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enter on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> a way, path, or journey: <cit><quote lang="la">cum semel institerunt vestigia certa viaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc an illuc iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes itinera insistant sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam insistam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.9" n="2" level="3"> In hostile sense, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press on;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effusis hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contenti non institere cedentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fracto jam Maroboduo, usque in exitium insisteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23868.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23868.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam domandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem pugnae,</quote> <trans><tr>plan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigiis laudum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23868.14" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n23868.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To follow up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue</hi> an object or enterprise; <hi rend="ital">to press vigorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus et mente et animo in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 176</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus magnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:135" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdomandae Campaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 77</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23868.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devote one's self to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to begin</hi> with zeal; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: tribuni orare dictatorem <cb n="INSO" /> insistunt, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appium institit sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 19, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 26, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 46, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die ad spolia legenda foedamque spectandam stragem insistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 51, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitare senatus institit Coruntum, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic institit ore,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>began to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic insistit secumque corde volutat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to reflect</tr>, <tr>think</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 533</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To persevere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">persist in;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin crudelitati insisteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to pursue diligently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeri,</quote> <trans><tr>to set forward</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 52, 53, § 177</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">importune,</quote> <trans><tr>to persist</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.18" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atriensibus ut supellectilem exponant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id bellum ipsis institit moenibus,</quote> <trans><tr>was at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 51, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilataque tempora taedae Institerant,</quote> <trans><tr>were at hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 769</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">institit quantum potuit ut illum ex eorum manibus liberaret,</quote> <trans><tr>urged</tr>, <tr>insisted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 63:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 63, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23868.19" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress;</hi> and hence, <hi rend="ital">to halt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum motus insistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non referat pedem, insistet certe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum dixisset paulumque institisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 56, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe accidit, ut aut citius insistendum sit, aut longius procedendum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66, 221</bibl></cit>; so, <hi rend="ital">to pause in thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille in reliquis rebus non poterit eodem modo insistere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23868.20" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dwell upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consider at length</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si singulis insistere velim, progredi iste non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:74:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 74, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insistendum ei (arbori) paulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profuit adsidue vitiis insistere amicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 315</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insiticius: <entryFree id="n23869" type="main" key="insi^ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insitio</etym>, <sense id="n23869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is inserted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafted</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.); <cit><quote lang="la">hence, trop.: somnus,</quote> <trans><tr>that is inserted between the occupations of the day</tr>, <tr>a noon-day nap</tr>, <tr>siesta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: muli, <hi rend="ital">produced from two species of animals</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">ingrafted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with inductus) sermo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>foreign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insitio: <entryFree id="n23870" type="main" key="insi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. insero</etym>. <sense id="n23870.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ingrafting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grafting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec consitiones modo delectant, sed etiam insitiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23870.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which is ingrafted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insitionem nutrire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23870.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The time of grafting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insitium: <entryFree id="n23871" type="gloss" key="insi^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insertion</hi>: insitium, <foreign lang="greek">e)/nqesis,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insitivus: <entryFree id="n23872" type="main" key="insi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ingrafted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grafted</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post - Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <trans><tr>adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimentum lactis,</quote> <trans><tr>of another person than the mother</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. n.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insitiva virtutum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insitor: <entryFree id="n23873" type="main" key="insi^tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ingrafter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grafter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 33, 76, § 329</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23874" type="main" key="Insi^tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Insĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god that presides over grafting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insitum: <entryFree id="n23875" type="main" key="insi^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. insero <sense id="n23875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insitus: <entryFree id="n23876" type="main" key="insi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. insero <sense id="n23876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23877" type="main" key="insi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in the <sense id="n23877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. insero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">an ingrafting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insochi: <entryFree id="n23878" type="main" key="Insochi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Insochi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n23878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 37</bibl> (dub.; al. Moschi).</sense></entryFree>
insociabilis: <entryFree id="n23879" type="main" key="inso^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be joined together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsociable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompatible</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversae, insociabilesque naturae arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 19, 30, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anum insociabilem nurui efficiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum (with discordiae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 17</bibl></cit>; 15, 68.</sense></entryFree>
insocialis: <entryFree id="n23880" type="main" key="inso^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, for insociabilis, <sense id="n23880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsociable</hi> (late Lat.): inconcinna, insocialis, Porphyr. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insolabiliter: <entryFree id="n23881" type="hapax" key="inso_la_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sōlābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-solor</etym>, <sense id="n23881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconsolably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insolatio: <entryFree id="n23882" type="hapax" key="inso_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insōlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insolo</etym>, <sense id="n23882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placing in the sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 14, 49, § 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insolatus: <entryFree id="n23883" type="main" key="inso_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insōlātus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of insolo. <pb n="967" /> <cb n="INSO" /></entryFree>
insolens: <entryFree id="n23884" type="main" key="inso^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-soleo</etym>. <sense id="n23884.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., i. q. insuetus, <hi rend="ital">contrary to custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaccustomed to</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not in use</hi> (class.); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu Athenas insolens?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatos deos flebit et aspera aequora emirabitur insolens (= antea insuetus tam celeris immutationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum, i. q. insuetum, insolitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: insolentissimum nomen, Quint. prooem. § 14.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera accipiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 48</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ruris colendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malarum artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n23884.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23884.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Excessive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderate; haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolenti alacritate gestire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec erat ei verendum, ne vera de se praedicans, nimis videretur aut insolens, aut loquax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in re nota multus et insolens sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam insolens sum, quam ineruditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:34:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 34, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam neque insolens, neque gloriosum ex ore ejus exiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna ludum insolentem ludere pertinax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 50</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundis rebus insolentiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: insolentissimi homines, Cael. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23884.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Extravagant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliena re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 342</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23884.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unfrequented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lonely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insŏlenter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n23884.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unusually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to custom</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">evenire insolenter et raro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentius hac figura uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23884.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Immoderately; haughtily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgias his festivitatibus insolentius abutitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem extinctum laete atque insolenter ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>with insolent exultation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriā suā insolenter gloriari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sorore irrisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis insequens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se insolentius jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentissime obequitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insolentia: <entryFree id="n23885" type="main" key="inso^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insolens</etym>. <sense id="n23885.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A being unaccustomed</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">unusualness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">novelty;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23885.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fori, judiciorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23885.2" n="B" level="2"> Rhet., <hi rend="ital">unusualness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">novelty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectedness</hi> in the choice of words: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:284" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentias verborum a veteribus dictorum respuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23885.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughtiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrogance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa tua singularis insolentia, superbia, contumacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Verr. 2:4:41:section=89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 41, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib. 2:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 44</bibl>, § 106; <hi rend="ital">lavish indulgence;</hi> opp. continentiam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Phil. 9:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Fam. 9:20:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:de Or. 2:52:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modeste insolentiam suam continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Agr. 1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex secundis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentiam alicui obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,017:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ag. 5</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus a noxiorum insolentiis premitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, epil. 31.</sense></entryFree>
insoleo: <entryFree id="n23886" type="hapax" key="inso^leo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏleo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wont</hi>, i. q. soleo, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 4</bibl> dub. (perh. solet).</sense></entryFree>
insolesco: <entryFree id="n23887" type="main" key="inso^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŏlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n23887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [insolens], <hi rend="ital">to become unusual</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strange.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23887.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the voice, <hi rend="ital">to begin to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become manly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepit Caelo vox insolescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the womb: uterus insolescens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>swelling up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Helv. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23887.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow haughty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become elated</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): ad superbiam, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per licentiam animus humanus insolescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:8:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insolidus: <entryFree id="n23888" type="hapax" key="inso^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not solid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insolite: <entryFree id="n23889" type="main" key="inso^li^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŏlĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insolitus, a, um, <sense id="n23889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insolitus: <entryFree id="n23890" type="main" key="inso^li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unaccustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23890.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unaccustomed to</hi> a thing; constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23890.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: cur pudentissimas feminas in tantum virorum conventum insolitas, invitasque<cb n="INSO" />  prodire cogis? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phocae,</quote> <trans><tr>not accustomed to rivers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 543</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23890.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolitus ad laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23890.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas insolita rerum bellicarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus serviti insolitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 81</bibl></cit> Dietsch. —</sense><sense id="n23890.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncommon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolita mihi loquacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:88:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 88, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentibus gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum et moribus veterum insolitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:554 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 554 al.</bibl>— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principe rarum ac prope insolitum est, ut se putet obligatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id insolitum esse fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 27</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insŏlĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusually</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">accidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
insollicitus: <entryFree id="n23891" type="gloss" key="insolli^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sollĭcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unconcerned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless</hi>: insollicitus dies, <foreign lang="greek">a)mnh/monos h(me/ra</foreign> (dub.; perh. <foreign lang="greek">a)me/rimnos</foreign>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
insolo: <entryFree id="n23892" type="main" key="inso_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-sol</etym>, <sense id="n23892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place in the sun</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">expose to the sun</hi>, in order to warm, dry, etc. (a favorite word with Columella): <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolati dies,</quote> <trans><tr>sunny</tr>, <tr>sunshiny days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus insolatur,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes warmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insolubilis: <entryFree id="n23893" type="main" key="inso^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be loosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indissoluble</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23893.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 28.— </sense><sense id="n23893.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23893.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be paid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneticium, creditum insolubile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23893.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be refuted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incontestable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23893.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That cannot be destroyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Asclep. p. 100, 37</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insŏlūbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">indissolubly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinciri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 10.</sense></entryFree>
insolubilitas: <entryFree id="n23894" type="hapax" key="inso^lu_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlūbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insolubilis</etym>, <sense id="n23894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insolubility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insolutus: <entryFree id="n23895" type="main" key="inso^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not solved</hi>: quaestio, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 23, 1.</sense></entryFree>
insomnia: <entryFree id="n23896" type="main" key="insomni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insomnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<number>plur.</number> <itype>insomnia</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25:47" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:329" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 329</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:6" default="NO">7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:140" default="NO">2, 140</bibl>) [insomnis], <sense id="n23896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleeplessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of sleep</hi> (class.): consequitur comes insomnia, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 209, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut mox noctu te adiget horsum insomnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit> Fleck. (Umpfenbach, adigent, v. insomnium): <cit><quote lang="la">incitabatur insomnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 50</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque insomniis, neque labore fatigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insomniis carere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insomnietas: <entryFree id="n23897" type="main" key="insomni^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insomnĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for insomnia, <sense id="n23897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleeplessness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insomniosus: <entryFree id="n23898" type="hapax" key="insomni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insomnĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>insomnia</etym>, <sense id="n23898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubled with want of sleep</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insomnis: <entryFree id="n23899" type="main" key="insomnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-somnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-somnus</etym>, <sense id="n23899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n23899.1" n="I" level="1"> Of living beings, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:54" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insomnes magis, quam pervigiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23899.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:328" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the dragon</tr>, <tr>from which armed men sprung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 239</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insomnium: <entryFree id="n23900" type="main" key="insomni^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insomnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>in-somnus</etym>, <sense id="n23900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dream</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n23900.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud haud ambigitur, qualicumque insomnio ipsi fratrique perniciem allatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per insomnium dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>in a dream</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa insomnii verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23900.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 13</bibl> Umpfenbach; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 896</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 358</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:102" default="NO">11, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23901" type="main" key="insomni^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insomnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, v. insomnia <sense id="n23901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insono: <entryFree id="n23902" type="main" key="inso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a noise in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound loudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae cum spiritus alto Insonat Aegaeo,</quote> <trans><tr>roars on the Ægean Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insonuere cavernae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli delapsa per auras Insonuit,</quote> <trans><tr>resounded flying through the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 596</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamis,</quote> <trans><tr>to play upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insonuitque flagello,</quote> <trans><tr>cracked his whip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 579</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera insonuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 451</bibl></cit>: quasi faucibus aliquid obstiterit, insonare, <hi rend="ital">to clear one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s throat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hawk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
