insons: <entryFree id="n23903" type="main" key="insons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sons</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n23903.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Guiltless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innocent;</hi> <cb n="INSP" /> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (class., but not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">insontem probri accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem falso atque insontem arguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publici consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 49</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si regni crimine insons fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">purus et insons ... si vivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hipp. 486" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hipp. 486</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 350</bibl>. — Esp., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insontes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the innocent</hi> (opp. sontes): <cit><quote lang="la">circumvenire, jugulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23903.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Harmless</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:682" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insonus: <entryFree id="n23904" type="main" key="inso^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŏnus</orth> <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n23904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">passus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23904.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: litterae, i. e. mutae, App. de Mundo, p. 66, 29.</sense></entryFree>
insopibilis: <entryFree id="n23905" type="main" key="inso_pi_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sōpībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-sopio</etym>, <sense id="n23905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be lulled to sleep</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inextinguishable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, § 910</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insopitus: <entryFree id="n23906" type="main" key="inso_pi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sōpītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not lulled to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wakeful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">draco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 357</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans><tr>inextinguishable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 401</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insordesco: <entryFree id="n23907" type="main" key="insordesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sordesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n23907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become dirty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">foul</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23907.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to become gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 617</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insortitus: <entryFree id="n23908" type="hapax" key="insorti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sortītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not allotted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula insortita (al. specula in sortitu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspargo: <entryFree id="n23909" type="main" key="inspargo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspargo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">insparsus</orth>, v. inspergo.</entryFree>
inspatior: <entryFree id="n23910" type="hapax" key="inspa^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spătĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n23910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to walk about in</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">inspatiantem (al. exspatiantem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 130</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspeciatus: <entryFree id="n23911" type="main" key="inspe^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spĕcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshapen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">substantia informis et inspeciata (late Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
inspeciosus: <entryFree id="n23912" type="hapax" key="inspe^ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spĕcĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshapely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ugly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. Trag. 74, 8</bibl></cit> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
inspectabilis: <entryFree id="n23913" type="main" key="inspecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inspecto</etym>, <sense id="n23913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worth looking at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspectatio: <entryFree id="n23914" type="main" key="inspecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inspecto</etym>, <sense id="n23914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">considering</hi> (post-Aug.).— <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 35</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 3</bibl>, read inseptiones).</sense></entryFree>
inspectator: <entryFree id="n23915" type="main" key="inspecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <etym>id.</etym>, for inspector, <sense id="n23915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overseer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 6:9" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inspectio: <entryFree id="n23916" type="main" key="inspecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inspicio</etym>, <sense id="n23916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspection</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23916.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23916.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ager prima inspectione neque vitia, neque virtutes abditas ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculi non tam possessio culpatur quam inspectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 13, p. 282, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23916.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a looking through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:2:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 3, 2, § 5</bibl>: rationum, Trajan. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 57, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23916.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplation;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">theory</hi>, in opposition to practice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:42" default="NO">2, 17, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:63:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 63, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:91:section=4" default="NO">45, 1, 91, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inspectivus: <entryFree id="n23917" type="main" key="inspecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inspectio</etym>, <sense id="n23917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">considering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reflecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplative</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pars rationis philosophiae (opp. actualis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspecto: <entryFree id="n23918" type="main" key="inspecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>inspicio</etym>, <sense id="n23918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi> (class. only in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quis inspectavit per impluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me inspectante,</quote> <trans><tr>before my eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inspectante exercitu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspectantibus nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">astante et inspectante ipso,</quote> <trans><tr>in his presence and before his eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspector: <entryFree id="n23919" type="main" key="inspector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n23919.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A viewer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observer</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23919.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inspector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 10</bibl>; Cod. Th. 11, 1, 31; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 1, 2 al.</sense></entryFree>
inspectrix: <entryFree id="n23920" type="main" key="inspectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inspector</etym>, <sense id="n23920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that inspects</hi> or <hi rend="ital">examines</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inspectus: <entryFree id="n23921" type="main" key="inspectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inspicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23922" type="main" key="inspectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inspicio</etym>. <sense id="n23922.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A looking at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an examination</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">jecoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23922.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Contemplation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus liber ad inspectum, oculis inspectu minacibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 6</bibl></cit>. <pb n="968" /> <cb n="INST" /></sense></entryFree>
insperabilis: <entryFree id="n23923" type="main" key="inspe_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spērābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be hoped for</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insperans: <entryFree id="n23924" type="main" key="inspe_rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spērans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (usually in the oblique cases), <sense id="n23924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not hoping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not expecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hopes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expectations</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">insperanti mihi, sed valde optanti cecidit, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus tu salutem insperantibus reddidisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperante hoc atque invito Pamphilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:107:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 107, 5</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: aetas, Inscr. ap. Grut. 1133, 15.</sense></entryFree>
insperate: <entryFree id="n23925" type="main" key="inspe_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspērātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">inspērātō</orth>, <sense id="n23925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. insperatus, a, um, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insperatus: <entryFree id="n23926" type="main" key="inspe_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spērātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unhoped for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unexpected</hi> (class.).—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">insperata accidunt magis saepe, quam quae speres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperatum et repentinum praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentinaeque pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 72</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperatissime mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of unpleasant things: <hi rend="ital">unlooked for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unforeseen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperatum et necopinatum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam necopinatum, nec tam insperatum accidere potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insperato,</quote> <trans><tr>unexpectedly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 6, § 17 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n23926.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inspērātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>, ext. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 11, 8</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n23926.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">inspērātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unexpectedly</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illam augeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit> Fleck.: abiit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 35, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulam invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:Argum. 1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. Argum. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insperato et contra opinionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 235, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspergo: <entryFree id="n23927" type="main" key="inspergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspergo</orth>, <itype>spersi, spersum</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spargo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl>; <sense id="n23927.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and insparsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 14, 87, § 140</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-spargo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sprinkle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scatter into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon; to sprinkle</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23927.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">molam ac vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farinam potioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 46, § 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaver panis rustici crustae inspergitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 53, § 168</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. means</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam sale,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 32</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23927.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregio inspersos reprehendas corpore naevos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspersio: <entryFree id="n23928" type="main" key="inspersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspersĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inspergo</etym>, <sense id="n23928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scattering upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspersion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cineris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspersus: <entryFree id="n23929" type="main" key="inspersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inspergo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23930" type="main" key="inspersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspersus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inspergo</etym>, <sense id="n23930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sprinkling upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspersion</hi> (post-class.; only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>, p. 231, 5.</sense></entryFree>
inspicio: <entryFree id="n23931" type="main" key="inspi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>inspecio</etym>, <sense id="n23931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look into; to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect; to consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23931.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">intro inspice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspicere tanquam in speculum, in vitas omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Romam inspexerit Eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:389" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspice quid portem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranarum viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea est procul inspicientibus natura loci, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum inspicere, ne subruptum siet,</quote> <trans><tr>to examine whether</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23931.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n23931.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect</hi> a thing with reference to its value, etc.: te hoc orare jussit, Ut sibi liceret inspicere has aedes. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Non sunt venales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">candelabrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venalem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:509" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 509</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23931.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To inspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, viros, equos, cum cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma militis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 61</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23931.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spy out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23931.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res sociorum,</quote> <trans><tr>to inspect their affairs</tr>, <tr>examine into their conduct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem a puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem diliges ut ego, si ut ego propius inspexeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquis, qui se inspici, aestimari fastidiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an possit fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:55:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 55, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid expediat, quid deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:8 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 8 al.</bibl></cit> <cb n="INST" /></sense></entryFree>
inspicium: <entryFree id="n23932" type="main" key="inspi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inspicio</etym>, <sense id="n23932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspection</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">extorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspico: <entryFree id="n23933" type="hapax" key="inspi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spīco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi> (i. q. incīdere): <cit><quote lang="la">faces (i. e. ligna in usum facium ita incidere, ut multis incisuris dividantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 292</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novas incidere faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 29</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
inspiramentum: <entryFree id="n23934" type="hapax" key="inspi_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspīrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inspiro</etym>, for inspiratio, <sense id="n23934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inspiration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:150" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inspirate: <entryFree id="n23935" type="main" key="inspi_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspīrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inspiro <sense id="n23935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inspiratio: <entryFree id="n23936" type="main" key="inspi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inspiration</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">litteraria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Patient. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspirator: <entryFree id="n23937" type="hapax" key="inspi_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inspīrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inspirer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:144" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 144</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">inspīrātrix</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, Jul. ap. Aug. contr. Sec. Resp. Jul. 198.</sense></entryFree>
inspiritalis: <entryFree id="n23938" type="hapax" key="inspi_ri^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spīrĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unspiritual</hi>, Paul Nol. ep. 22.</sense></entryFree>
inspiro: <entryFree id="n23939" type="main" key="inspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n23939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to blow into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to breathe into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspire</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to blow into;</hi> with the simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 84</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To blow upon;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulā sensim graviusculum sonum inspirare,</quote> <trans><tr>to blow upon the flute</tr>, <tr>produce by blowing on the flute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: Atticos <foreign lang="greek">ixqu/n, i(ro/n</foreign> inspirantis primae litterae dixisse, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce with a breathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aspirate</hi> a letter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui animam,</quote> <trans><tr>to breathe into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 15, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in faciem ejus spiraculum vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gen. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si gravitati aurium per fistulas inspiretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 127</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to breathe into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultum ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam mentem animumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:194" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram, misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus viribus inspiret (orator),</quote> <trans><tr>animate</tr>, <tr>inflame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO">5, 14, 32</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23939.3" n="B" level="2"> Of religious feeling or influence, <hi rend="ital">to inspire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde adhuc, qui inspirari solent, fatuari dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spiritu Sancto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 21 et saep.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inspīrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inspiredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inspiratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit> (dub. al. insperatius).</sense></entryFree>
inspissatus: <entryFree id="n23940" type="hapax" key="inspissa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spissātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thickened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insplendesco: <entryFree id="n23941" type="main" key="insplendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-splendesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n23941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illuminate</hi>: insplendesco, <foreign lang="greek">e)nla/mpw,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
inspoliatus: <entryFree id="n23942" type="main" key="inspo^li^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spŏlĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not plundered</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">occi sus est non praedae gratiā, quia inspoliatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 594</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspumo: <entryFree id="n23943" type="main" key="inspu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spūmo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to foam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">O impiae voces! infrendite, inspumate, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inspuo: <entryFree id="n23944" type="main" key="inspu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spŭo</orth>, <itype>spŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n23944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spit into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23944.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in frontem mediam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in faciem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23944.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculis jumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 21, 25, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inspurco: <entryFree id="n23945" type="main" key="inspurco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spurco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to defile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum illum pecunia purum effecit, an ipse pecuniam inspurcavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insputo: <entryFree id="n23946" type="main" key="inspu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-spūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n23946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [inspuo], <hi rend="ital">to spit upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ain' eum mihi esse morbum, ut qui med opus sit insputarier? ... quibus insputari saluti fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instabilio: <entryFree id="n23947" type="main" key="insta^bi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stăbĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>, Hyg. de Munit. Castr. § 54.</sense></entryFree>
instabilis: <entryFree id="n23948" type="main" key="insta^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stăbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does not stand fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsteady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unstable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tottering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not firm</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. varius, mutabilis, vagus; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n23948.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic erat instabilis tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus ad gradum instabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with lubricus) gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:22:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 33, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unsteady</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that does not keep its ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(with fluctuans) acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 18, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23948.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unstable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fickle</hi>: insanam aiunt (Fortunam), quia atrox, incerta instabilisque sit, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl>: res <cb n="INST" /> maritimae celerem atque instabilem mo tum habent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam instabile ac fluxum est, quam fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 105</bibl></cit> (but read insatiabiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 19</bibl>). — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">instă-bĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unsteadily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 13:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 13, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instabilitas: <entryFree id="n23949" type="main" key="insta^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instăbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>instabilis</etym>, <sense id="n23949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsteadiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instability</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. inconstantia): mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instabiliter: <entryFree id="n23950" type="main" key="insta^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instăbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> v. instabilis <sense id="n23950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
instagno: <entryFree id="n23951" type="main" key="instagno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stagno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overflow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instans: <entryFree id="n23952" type="main" key="instans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instans</orth>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. insto <sense id="n23952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
instanter: <entryFree id="n23953" type="main" key="instanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insto <sense id="n23953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
instantia: <entryFree id="n23954" type="main" key="instanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insto</etym>. <sense id="n23954.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a being near</hi> or <hi rend="ital">close upon</hi>, hence <hi rend="ital">presence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">futura quorum consequenti tempore vera erit instantia, ea vera dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 12, 27</bibl></cit> B. and K.: infestus dicitur ab instantia atque imminentia fraudis, <hi rend="ital">the immediate and threatening character of the injury</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 12, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23954.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">steadiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perseverance; force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi> in speaking; <hi rend="ital">earnestness</hi> in supplication, <hi rend="ital">importunity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urgency</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim, quod haec instantia non possit efficere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio maxime vi, amaritudine, instantiā placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. tarditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetendi debiti instantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed instantia Byrrhaenae perfecit, ut vellet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaci negare instantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instar: <entryFree id="n23955" type="main" key="instar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instar</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> <etym>perh. in and root sta-; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(/sthmi, sth/lh,</foreign> etc.</etym>. <sense id="n23955.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sketch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvum instar eorum, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23955.1" n="B" level="2"> Ad instar, or simply instar. </sense><sense id="n23955.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">According to the likeness of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the fashion of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23955.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Ad instar, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vallis continuis montibus ad instar castrorum clauditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad instar proprietatis, non ad instar possessionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23955.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Instar, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Erana, quae fuit non vici instar, sed urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instar muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instar montis equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina ea partium urbis et instal urbium sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb.—</sense><sense id="n23955.5" n="2" level="3"> Instar, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes quaedam, quod instar legionis videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videretis vix duarum male plenarum legiuncularum instar in castris regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites dati duarum instar legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet Tiro instar septuaginta (mearum epistularum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librorum octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23955.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum instar in ipso!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 865</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ad universi caeli complexum quasi puncti instar obtinet,</quote> <trans><tr>has almost the appearance of</tr>, <tr>looks almost like a point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23955.7" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Worth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia vix minimi momenti instar habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ille dies mihi immortalitatis instar fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>was worth immortality to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus is innumeri militis instar habet,</quote> <trans><tr>is as good as</tr>, <tr>equivalent to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plato mihi unus instar est omnium,</quote> <trans><tr>is to me worth them all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:191" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clientes appellari, mortis instar putant,</quote> <trans><tr>is as bad as death to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instauraticius: <entryFree id="n23956" type="main" key="instaura_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instaurātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tītĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>instauro</etym>, <sense id="n23956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">renewed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeated</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the day when the games are repeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instauratio: <entryFree id="n23957" type="main" key="instaura_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instaurātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renewal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repetition</hi>: ludorum, Auct. Har. Resp. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum,</quote> <trans><tr>restoration</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Const. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: causae, Paul Sent. 5, 5, a. 10.</sense></entryFree>
instauratitius: <entryFree id="n23958" type="main" key="instaura_ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instaurātītĭus</orth>, v. instauraticius.</entryFree>
instaurativus: <entryFree id="n23959" type="main" key="instaura_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instaurātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>instauro</etym>, <sense id="n23959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">renewed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instaurator: <entryFree id="n23960" type="main" key="instaura_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instaurātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a renewer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restorer</hi> (post-class.): moenium, Inscr. ap. Reines. 2, 31; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instauro: <entryFree id="n23961" type="main" key="instauro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stauro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>staurus, obs., = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stauro/s,</foreign> a paling, stake; cf. Sanscr. sthavaras, firm; root stare, <foreign lang="greek">i(/sthmi</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n23961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to renew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrate anew; to repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore; to erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> (syn.: renovo, integro; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): Latinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedem, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 3: (with renovare) scelus pristinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum de integro bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestis pugnam sagittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 74</bibl></cit>: societatem. <pb n="969" /> <cb n="INST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus operis, auspicandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:98" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinere aut gypso instaurare vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi monumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi tunicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instaurati animi,</quote> <trans><tr>refreshed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum diis loci,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer</tr>, <tr>perform</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dī, talia Graiis, Instaurate,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to repay</tr>, <tr>requite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigiles popinas,</quote> <trans><tr>to frequent anew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insterno: <entryFree id="n23962" type="main" key="insterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n23962.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrata cubilia fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:987" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 987</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">instratos ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 277</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si palo adacto caverna paleā insternatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontes altos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 675</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23962.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay upon as a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread over</hi>: modicis instravit pulpita tignis (<case>dat.</case>), <hi rend="ital">laid the stage over an insignificant scaffolding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 279</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n23962.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throw into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese Ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:800" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 800</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instigatio: <entryFree id="n23963" type="main" key="insti_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instīgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>instigo</etym>, <sense id="n23963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an urging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercalibus instigationibus corrupti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instigator: <entryFree id="n23964" type="main" key="insti_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instīgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stimulator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quisque dux et instigator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superfluus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instigatrix: <entryFree id="n23965" type="main" key="insti_ga_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instīgātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>instigator</etym>, <sense id="n23965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that instigates</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">acerrima adversum Galbianos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instigatus: <entryFree id="n23966" type="main" key="insti_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instīgātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>instigo</etym>, <sense id="n23966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si instigatu alterius fera damnum dederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instigo: <entryFree id="n23967" type="main" key="insti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instīgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from in and stigo (unused), cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sti/zw;</foreign> Sanscr. tig, tij, to be sharp; cf. stimulus for stig-mulus, stilus for stig-lus</etym>, <sense id="n23967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si hic non insanit satis sua sponte, instiga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instigante te,</quote> <trans><tr>at your instigation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncti sequentem Instigant studiis,</quote> <trans><tr>stimulate him in the pursuit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 730</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos in Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comites agmen instigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arma,</quote> <trans><tr>to rouse to arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canem in aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to set on one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 10</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1082" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1082</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instillatio: <entryFree id="n23968" type="main" key="instilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>instillo</etym>, <sense id="n23968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dropping in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instillation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instillo: <entryFree id="n23969" type="main" key="instillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour in by drops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to instil</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n23969.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quoque, nisi tamquam lumini, oleum instilles, extinguuntur senectute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11</bibl></cit>: (oleum) caulibus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus sucum brassicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 83</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23969.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drop into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>: guttae, quae saxa assidue instillant Caucasi, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n23969.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to instil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inspire with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uberrimae tuae litterae mihi quiddam quasi animulae instillarunt (al. restillarunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptum auriculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instimulator: <entryFree id="n23970" type="main" key="insti^mu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭmŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>instimulo</etym>, <sense id="n23970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stimulator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionis (al. stimulator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instimulo: <entryFree id="n23971" type="main" key="insti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urge on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stimulate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:508" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 495</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:715" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:543" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falso instimulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instinctor: <entryFree id="n23972" type="main" key="instinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instinctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>instinguo</etym>, <sense id="n23972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instigator</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instinctus: <entryFree id="n23973" type="main" key="instinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from instinguo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23974" type="main" key="instinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>instinguo</etym>, <sense id="n23974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">instigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impulse</hi> (class.; mostly in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">oracula, quae instinctu divino afflatuque funduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>inspiration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">1. 31, 66: sine caelesti aliquo mentis instinctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instinctu decurionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instinctibus daemonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>: ex instinctu deorum dicere, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 2, 5.</sense></entryFree>
instinguo: <entryFree id="n23975" type="main" key="instinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stinguo</orth>, <itype>stinxi, stinctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to instigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi> (class. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Christus intus instinxerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 26</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 7</bibl>, read instrinxit).— <hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">instinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">instigated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furore et audaciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>: his vocibus, <hi rend="ital">fired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animated</hi>,<cb n="INST" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divino spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum jucunditatibus instinctae mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
instipo: <entryFree id="n23976" type="main" key="insti_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stīpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n23976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stuff into</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vinum in culleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instipulor: <entryFree id="n23977" type="main" key="insti^pu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stĭpŭlor</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n23977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bargain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate for</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">dolo malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 25</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 7</bibl>, est stipulatus, Ritschl).</sense></entryFree>
instita: <entryFree id="n23978" type="main" key="insti^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insisto</etym>. <sense id="n23978.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The border</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flounce</hi> (laid in several plaits) <hi rend="ital">of a Roman lady</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s tunic</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quarum subsutā talos tegit instita veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>no lady</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:600" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 600</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23978.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bandage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 97, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 133" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:654" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 654</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
institio: <entryFree id="n23979" type="hapax" key="insti^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing still</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errantium stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
institium: <entryFree id="n23980" type="hapax" key="insti^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = institio, <sense id="n23980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing still</hi>, Kalend. ap. Grut. 138.</sense></entryFree>
instito: <entryFree id="n23981" type="spur" key="insti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, a false read. for instare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl>.</entryFree>
institor: <entryFree id="n23982" type="main" key="insti^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>insisto</etym>, <sense id="n23982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a person who sells goods for another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a factor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agent; a huckster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hawker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peddler</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circulator, negotiator): amata nautis multum et institoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernae tegetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 221</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23982.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <trans><tr>who hawks about his eloquence</tr>, <tr>makes an exhibition of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
institorius: <entryFree id="n23983" type="main" key="insti^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>institor</etym>, <sense id="n23983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to</hi> institores (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n23983.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes, Hier. ap. Helv. 21: actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:71" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:74" default="NO">74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23983.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female broker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">huckster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instituo: <entryFree id="n23984" type="main" key="insti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum</itype> (institivi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 2</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>in-statuo</etym>. <sense id="n23984.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> (cf.: instruo, informo; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): vestigia nuda sinistri Instituere pedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 690</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: argumenta in pectus multa institui, <hi rend="ital">I have put</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">formed in my heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: quemquamne hominem in animum instituere, aut parare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to set his heart on</hi> (al. in animo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23984.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pratum,</quote> <bibl
