n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera tercenta, ubi institui vineae possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portorium vini,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay on</tr>, <tr>impose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituit officinam Syracusis in regia maximam,</quote> <trans><tr>founded</tr>, <tr>erected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicem et conscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23984.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fabricate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus muralium pilorum numerus instituitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to build</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to construct</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora coepit institui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiorem sermonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remiges ex provincia,</quote> <trans><tr>to obtain</tr>, <tr>procure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23984.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi> (viands, food, a feast, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia jucunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23984.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23984.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To institute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">organize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi> (of institutions, governments, etc.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi regnum magnum institutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in magistratu non institutum est a me regnum, sed repressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de civitatibus instituendis littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatis formam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is id regnum cum fratribus suis instituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab instituta gente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegium figulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 5</bibl></cit>.—So of holidays, games, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferias diesque festos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnalia institutus festus dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacros ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 446</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23984.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To institute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi> one, esp. as heir or to an office: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me cum tutorem, tum etiam secundum heredem instituerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Populum Romanum tutorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitel. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n23984.7" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ordain that</hi>: Arcesilas instituit, ut ii, qui, etc., Cic. <cb n="INST" /> Fin. 2, 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fierent quaestores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 58</bibl>.—With the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituit, quotannis subsortitio a praetore fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23984.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cenas hodie, si hanc rationem instituis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Zenone Arcesilas sibi omne certamen instituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23984.9" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id negotium institutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si diligentiam, quam instituisti, adhibueris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perge tenere istam viam, quam instituisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 14" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc ipsum quaedam institui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia nec institui potest sine, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 5</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum Velia navigare coepi, institui Topica conscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quae non nupta mulier virorum alienissimorum conviviis uti instituerit,</quote> <trans><tr>begun</tr>, <tr>made it a practice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitare omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 84</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n23984.10" n="F" level="1"> Of troops, <hi rend="ital">to draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu actionem instituis, ille aciem instruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartae aciei quam instituerat, signum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23984.11" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos sibi amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad cogitandum,</quote> <trans><tr>apply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23984.12" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resolve upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praesentia (Caesar) similem rationem operis instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 42, 1</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex scribere historias instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cat. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cat. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere tempus ejus interficiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montanos oppugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronas ad ipsum mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum plebi dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23984.13" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienter vitam instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri de civitatibus instituendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23984.14" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To teach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">educate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tu instituis adulescentes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: oratorem, Quint.1, 1, 21.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latine loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pan primus calamos cerā conjungere plures Instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora fumum bibere instituta Consule Tullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibiis canere voce instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem disciplinis Graecis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:39:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 39, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem artibus et moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filios instituere atque erudire ad majorum instituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">§ 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad lectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem tu a puero sic instituisses, ut nobili ne gladiatori quidem faveret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos, ne quem coleremus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 18</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:8 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
institutio: <entryFree id="n23985" type="main" key="insti^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>instituo</etym>, <sense id="n23985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:13:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23985.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutionem suam conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n23985.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Instruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">education</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23985.3" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Principles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elements of instruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures Graecis institutionibus eruditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex institutione Stoica se agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23985.4" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Induction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:14:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:116" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 116</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
institutor: <entryFree id="n23986" type="main" key="insti^tu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erector</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contractor</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">veteres urbium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordidissimorum artificiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n23986.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instructor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
institutum: <entryFree id="n23987" type="main" key="insti^tu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n23987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design; an arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plan; mode of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manners; a regulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">institution; instruction; agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus omne institutum voluntatemque omnem successio prospera consecuta est, Cic. Hortens. Fragm.: ad hujus libri institutum illa nihil pertinent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nunc oblitum consuetudinis et instituti mei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cael. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to form a plan of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris publici leges et instituta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 77</bibl></cit>: instituta <pb n="970" /> <cb n="INST" /> Parthorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">institutis patriae parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta institutaque philosophiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimis institutis mentem infantium informare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: ex instituto, <hi rend="ital">according to law</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tradition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem ex instituto dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 13, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
institutus: <entryFree id="n23988" type="main" key="insti^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from instituo.</entryFree>
insto: <entryFree id="n23989" type="main" key="insto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stātum</itype> (e. g. instaturum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36, 3</bibl>: <sense id="n23989.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">instaturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:6:10 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 6, 10 al.</bibl></cit>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stand in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi> a thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n23989.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23989.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., constr. with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n23989.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 529</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23989.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: saxo in globoso, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 367 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">instans in medio triclinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23989.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw nigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach; to impend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threaten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ego confido impendere fatum aliquod, et poenas jam diu debitas aut instare jam plane, aut certe jam appropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instant apparatissimi magnificentissimique ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illi iter instaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid subiti et magni discriminis instat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:520" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante factis omissis, illud quod instet, agi oportere,</quote> <trans><tr>the subject in hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 11, 37</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of persons: cum legionibus instare Varum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23989.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum eum instat exitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23989.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to press upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">menace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threaten.</hi>—With <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23989.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instantem regi cometen videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:407" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 407</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23989.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me instabunt (al. mi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23989.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n23989.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To urge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press upon</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to insist; to pursue</hi> a thing (syn. urgeo): <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem urge, insta, perfice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille instat factum (esse),</quote> <trans><tr>he insists upon the fact</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To follow up eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pursue;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n23989.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instant operi regnisque futuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus instans monitis (parens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:210" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ignarus instandum famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23989.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to urge forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transact with zeal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diligence</hi>: instant mercaturam, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 30</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 223 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">parte aliā Marti currumque, rotasque volucres Instabant,</quote> <trans><tr>were hastening forward</tr>, <tr>working hard at</tr>, <tr>busily constructing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 434</bibl></cit>: rectam viam, <hi rend="ital">to go right</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be right</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hit the mark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum instare de indutiis vehementissime contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 385.—</sense><sense id="n23989.14" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox domini instantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n23989.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To demand earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insist upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis est, quod instat de Milone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod profecto cum sua sponte, tum, te instante, faciet,</quote> <trans><tr>at your instance</tr>, <tr>your solicitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instat Scandilius poscere recuperatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:59:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 59, § 136</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi instat Hortensius, ut eas in consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor acriter tua instat, ne mihi detur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc nosmet ipsi nobis instemus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 56, 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto, si instetur, suo milite vinci Romam posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">instans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n23989.16" n="A" level="2"> (Standing by, being near, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">Present.</hi> </sense><sense id="n23989.17" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae venientia metuuntur, eadem efficiunt aegritudinem instantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex controversia futuri, raro etiam ex instantis aut facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n23989.18" n="2" level="3"> In partic., gram. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, i.q. praesens tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>the present tense</tr>, <tr>the present</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 147</bibl> P. et saep.—</sense><sense id="n23989.19" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pressing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importunate</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species terribilior jam et instantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus acer atque instans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 92 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio acrior et instantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">164: admonitio instantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">instanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intente instanterque pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura acriter et instanter incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 126</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instantius concurrere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fight more vehemently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instantissime desiderare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instragulum: <entryFree id="n23990" type="main" key="instra_gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrāgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>insterno</etym>, <sense id="n23990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coverlet</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 11</bibl>. <cb n="INST" /></sense></entryFree>
instratum: <entryFree id="n23991" type="main" key="instra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>insterno</etym>, <sense id="n23991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instratus: <entryFree id="n23992" type="main" key="instra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from insterno.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n23993" type="hapax" key="instra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-strātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. insterno</etym>, <sense id="n23993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not covered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <trans><tr>an unspread couch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 230</bibl></cit> (so interpp. plur. ad loc.; but it is better to construe instrato as <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> of insterno, with frondibus hirsutis; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">instrata cubilia fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:987" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 987</bibl></cit> Wakef. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
instrenue: <entryFree id="n23994" type="main" key="instre_nu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrēnŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. instrenuus, a, um, <sense id="n23994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
instrenuus: <entryFree id="n23995" type="main" key="instre_nu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-strēnŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n23995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not brisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiritless</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">instrēnŭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non instrenue moriens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instrepito: <entryFree id="n23996" type="main" key="instre^pi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrĕpĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n23996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. freq.</hi> [instrepo], <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi> anywhere (late Lat.): floribus instrepitans (apis). <hi rend="ital">humming over the flowers</hi>, Ven. Carm. 3, 9, 26.</sense></entryFree>
instrepo: <entryFree id="n23997" type="main" key="instre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-strĕpo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi> anywhere; <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creak</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): sub pondere faginus axis Instrepat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to gnash</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 222</bibl></cit>.—With a Gr. <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to make resound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to utter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentabiles questus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126, 36</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, the correct read. is increparet).</sense></entryFree>
instrictus: <entryFree id="n23998" type="main" key="instrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from instringo.</entryFree>
instrido: <entryFree id="n23999" type="main" key="instri_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-strīdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n23999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hiss in</hi> a place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fax instridens pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:435" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 435</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instringo: <entryFree id="n24000" type="main" key="instringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stringo</orth>, <itype>nxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24000.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chain</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not anteAug.): aliquem vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc feralibus amiculis instrictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 10, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24000.1" n="II" level="1"> Of a weapon, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brandish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ in attack</hi>: nam si gladium instrinxit, quid dubium est quin occidendi animo percusserit? Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 1, 6, 3.—</sense><sense id="n24000.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divino spiritu instrictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 15, 10</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> so, uxor dolore, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 225, 9 (Hild., instinctus): <cit><quote lang="la">haec admonitio Tauri non modo non repressit, sed instrinxit etiam nos ad elegantiam Graecae orationis affectandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 7</bibl></cit> Hertz.</sense></entryFree>
instructe: <entryFree id="n24001" type="main" key="instructe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instructē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. instruo <sense id="n24001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
instructilis: <entryFree id="n24002" type="main" key="instructi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-structĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not compound</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instructio: <entryFree id="n24003" type="main" key="instructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-structĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a constructing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erecting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">building.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24003.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: novi balinei, Trajan. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubulorum in cloacas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a sinking into</tr>, <tr>insertion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24003.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an arranging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting in array</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caec. 15, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n24003.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina, institutio, disciplina): futuri temporis pro instructione (al. per structionem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instructor: <entryFree id="n24004" type="main" key="instructor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instructor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>instruo</etym>, <sense id="n24004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instructura: <entryFree id="n24005" type="main" key="instructu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instructūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n24005.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a building in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barrier</hi>, Gromat. Vet. p. 347, 8.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Gromat. Vet. p. 255, 25; p. 349, 14.—</sense><sense id="n24005.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24005.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Array</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order of battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:17" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24005.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construction</hi> of discourse, Fronto ad M. <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 2</bibl>, ep. 1.</sense></entryFree>
instructus: <entryFree id="n24006" type="main" key="instructus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. instruo <sense id="n24006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24007" type="hapax" key="instructus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instructus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>instruo</etym>, <sense id="n24007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arrangement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (syn. apparatus): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio eodem est instructu ornatuque comitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instrumentum: <entryFree id="n24008" type="main" key="instru_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">instrūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement</hi> of any kind, <hi rend="ital">a utensil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instrument</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24008.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culinarum argentea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelia jussae instrumenta necis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 698</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24008.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">sing. collect.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">material</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum ac ornamenta villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:24:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 24, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes magna impensā magnoque instrumento tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli instrumentum et apparatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: rusticum,<cb n="INST" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium spolia, monumenta imperatorum, decora atque ornamenta fanorum, in instrumento atque in supellectile Verris nominabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nauticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 41</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in law, <hi rend="ital">the personalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chattels</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stock</hi> of a farm, business, trade, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundo legato, neque instrumentum fundi ... ad legatarium pertinet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumento cauponio legato, ea debentur, quae in cauponis usum parata sunt, velut vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pistoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">64: medici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in fanis alia vasorum sunt et sacrae supellectilis, alia ornamentorum, quae vasorum sunt instrumenti instar habent, quibus sacrificia conficiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>apparatus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24008.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24008.4" n="A" level="2"> Of writings, <hi rend="ital">an instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">document</hi>, <hi rend="ital">record</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est intueri omne litis instrumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerearum tabularum tria milia ... instrumentum imperii pulcherrimum ac vetustissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publici instrumenti auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emtionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si scriptum fuerit instrumento, promisisse aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentorum obligatio desideratur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24008.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Store</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">means</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furtherance</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris,</quote> <trans><tr>provision</tr>, <tr>supply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid viatici, quid instrumenti satis sit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for a journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumenta ad obtinendam sapientiam,</quote> <trans><tr>means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 77, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviorum artium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciborum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>organs of digestion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 168</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24008.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices ornent haec instrumenta libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anilia,</quote> <trans><tr>apparel</tr>, <tr>dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 766</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
instruo: <entryFree id="n24009" type="main" key="instru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi</itype> (<sense id="n24009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> instruxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 34</bibl>), <itype>ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to build in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into; to build,</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24009.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24009.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">contabulationem in parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubulos in earum (cloacarum) parietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24009.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24009.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set in order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw up in battle array</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra copias praesidia vestrosque exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad instruendum spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 19, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 48, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias in loco aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay an ambush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Clu. 66:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 66, 190</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem insidiis instruendis locum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies circa vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc modum aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo in plures ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24009.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make ready</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit out</hi> (with necessaries): <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruere et parare convivium omnibus rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">62: mensas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 571</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to stock</tr>, <tr>furnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumento et stipendio victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dotare filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieri aurum atque ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruit focum provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios simul instruit armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubinas securibus peltisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xerxes bellum per quinquennium instruxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:2" default="NO">8, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24009.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24009.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to procure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in instruendo (orationem) dissipatus,</quote> <trans><tr>in arranging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 59, 216</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad judicium nondum se satis instruxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque spatium erat instruendi bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24009.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to provide with information</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to teach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratores) parum his artibus instructos vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:214" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 59, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem notitiā rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes salubribus praeceptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 140</bibl></cit>: aliquem scientiā alicujus rei, Quint. prooem. § 23; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 1 al.</bibl>— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Just. praef. 4 (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 30, 72</bibl>, the true reading is instituimur).— </sense><sense id="n24009.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To plan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas res hic agito in mentem instruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruendae fraudi intentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 14</bibl></cit>: insidias <pb n="971" /> <cb n="INSU" /> mihi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 18</bibl> (21), 7.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">instructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ordered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawn up; furnished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provided</hi> with any thing. </sense><sense id="n24009.10" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus ita stetit instructus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilia rebus iis omnibus, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instructa et exornata domus,</quote> <trans><tr>provided with necessaries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instructae ornataeque naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 51</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">133: instructae atque ornatae omnibus rebus copiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus instructum et paratum convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24009.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24009.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Arranged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepared; instructed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam instructa sunt mihi in corde consilia omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res satis scite instructae et compositae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad permovendos animos instructi et parati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem contemnendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum instructissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24009.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Instructed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ingenuis artibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a jure civili, ab historia instructior (v. ab),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In a bad sense: accusatores instructi et subornati,</quote> <trans><tr>prepared</tr>, <tr>instructed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis instructior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">instructē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with great preparation;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos opulentius instructius facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instructius accusare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 34, p. 296</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instudiosus: <entryFree id="n24010" type="main" key="instu^di^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stŭdĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not studious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regardless of</hi> a thing; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
instupeo: <entryFree id="n24011" type="main" key="instu^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-stŭpĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be torpid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numb;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membro instupente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuasabilitas: <entryFree id="n24012" type="main" key="insua_sa^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuāsăbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in-suadeo</etym>, <sense id="n24012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the incapacity to be persuaded</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Eph. 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insuasum: <entryFree id="n24013" type="hapax" key="insua_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insuāsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of dark color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tibi insuaso infecisti pallulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
insuavis: <entryFree id="n24014" type="main" key="insu^a_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭāvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba cibo non insuavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 97, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid insuavius quam clamor?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insuavissima littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 49, 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insuavitas: <entryFree id="n24015" type="main" key="insu^a_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭāvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>insuavis</etym>, <sense id="n24015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unpleasantness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreeableness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">per insuavitatem medentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Martyr. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Poen. 10: dictionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:115" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insubditivus: <entryFree id="n24016" type="main" key="insubdi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-subdĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not supposititious</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">matris semen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
insuber: <entryFree id="n24017" type="main" key="Insu^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Insŭber</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (Insubris for Insuber, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Julian. 1</bibl>; <sense id="n24017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Insubrium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Insubrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 125</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Insubria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country in the neighborhood of Milan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Insubrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Insŭber</orth>, <hi rend="ital">an Insubrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Insuber quidam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 34</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Insŭbres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Insubrians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 34, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
insubide: <entryFree id="n24018" type="main" key="insu^bi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭbĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. insubidus <sense id="n24018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
insubidus: <entryFree id="n24019" type="main" key="insu^bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolish</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:4" default="NO">13, 20, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-sŭbĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stupidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid non insubide introspicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 14, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
insubjectus: <entryFree id="n24020" type="main" key="insubjectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-subjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsubjected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsubdued</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 699</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insubres: <entryFree id="n24021" type="main" key="Insu^bres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Insŭbres</orth>, v. Insuber.</entryFree>
insubsidiatus: <entryFree id="n24022" type="main" key="insubsi^di^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insubsĭdĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-subsidior</etym>, <sense id="n24022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsupported</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,017:3:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esdr. 3, 9, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insubstantivus: <entryFree id="n24023" type="main" key="insubstanti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-substantīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsubstantial</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 1, 2, 7; Interpr. Iren. 1, 10.</sense></entryFree>
insubtilis: <entryFree id="n24024" type="main" key="insubti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-subtīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not subtle</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">insubtīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without subtlety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 7, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:1" default="NO">28, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insubulum: <entryFree id="n24025" type="main" key="insu^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insŭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for insilia, <sense id="n24025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the treadle of a weaver</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s loom</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 29, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
insubvertibilis: <entryFree id="n24026" type="main" key="insubverti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insubvertĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n24026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be overturned</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Anon. (Hilar.) in Job, 11, p. 186.</sense></entryFree>
insuco: <entryFree id="n24027" type="main" key="insu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">insūco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n24027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a</hi> [1. in-sucus], <hi rend="ital">to soak in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steep</hi> (a favorite word of Columella): <cit><quote lang="la">lanam vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:18" default="NO">7, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>, <cb n="INSU" /> 13, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">panem ex mulso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:8:77" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 8, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
